original: Another week just flew by me. I drove by the new house yesterday and the front window was covered in boxes. We may get the keys at closing, i am getting so excited. If all goes well this week, we will be set for closing a week from wednesday. I was up until after 3:00am last night watching movies with bethany. There has been a lot of movie watching going on around here lately. Here's my rundown; last night we watched thirteen, a movie every mother of a teen should see. It was better then i expected. Then we watched gigli, yeah it was just as bad as the media said it was, but we had to see for ourselves.
polished: Another week just flew by. I drove past the new house yesterday, and the front window was covered in boxes. We may get the keys at closing; I am so excited. If all goes well this week, we'll be set for closing a week from Wednesday. I was up until after 3:00 a.m. last night, watching movies with Bethany. There's been a lot of movie-watching happening here lately. Here's my rundown: Last night, we watched "Thirteen," a movie every mother of a teen should see. It was better than I expected. Then we watched "Gigli," and, yes, it was just as bad as the media said, but we had to see for ourselves.

original: Summer tv tv in the summer used to be a dead zone full of repeats or something. But now there are two great new shows on tv and i have been watching both religiously for the last week. Blow out the gayest concept ever that seemingly has zero gay people in sight. Hairstylist jonothan antin wants build a second location to his incredibly popular west hollywood salon but this time in beverly hills. Normally no one would care, certainly not i, but as i was flipping thru the channels i caught a glipse of jonothan, equally narcissistic and dull looking at a empty space on rodeo dr speak (in a public voice) 'i am going to build here the greatest salon in the history of the world ever!' and i was hooked. Not since rocco have i found such a moron compelling tv watching.
polished: Summer TV used to be a dead zone full of repeats. But now, there are two great new shows on TV, and I have been watching both religiously for the last week. "Blow Out," with the most extravagant concept, surprisingly features no gay people in sight. Hairstylist Jonathan Antin wants to build a second location for his incredibly popular West Hollywood salon, this time in Beverly Hills. Normally, no one, especially not I, would care. However, as I was flipping through the channels, I caught a glimpse of Jonathan, equally narcissistic and dull, looking at an empty space on Rodeo Dr., declaring, "I am going to build here the greatest salon in the history of the world ever!" and I was hooked. Not since Rocco have I found such a moron compelling TV viewing.

original: What a week ... My right shoulder has tendonitus. It's right under my shoulder blade. So, when i move my arm too much, mainly with a mouse on a computer .... It kills me. I can't move it much now because i was on a spree updating my website and working on other online things. I can barely get up strength to draw anything. Lack of sleep adds to my pain. I'm not too happy right now, but i'll get better. My mom's surgery went ok. Her eyesight has come back some. She can see fuzzy shapes and make out colors. Other than that she's still blind as all sin. Hopefully she'll fully regain her vision soon.
polished: What a week ... My right shoulder has tendonitis. It's right under my shoulder blade. So, when I move my arm too much, mainly with a mouse on a computer... it hurts. I can't move it much now because I went on a spree updating my website and working on other online tasks. I can barely find the strength to draw anything. Lack of sleep adds to my pain. I'm not too happy right now, but I'll get better. My mom's surgery went okay. Her eyesight has improved somewhat. She can see fuzzy shapes and make out colors. Other than that, she's still blind. Hopefully, she'll fully regain her vision soon.

original: Kindness of strangers... Attempted laundry today with the kids in tow and realized how very quickly the simplest things can become a freaking ordeal. I also learned how remarkably sweet total strangers can be for no reason other than because they feel like being sweet. Trust me. It wasn't like they were trying to get into my pants or anything. I had kid drool all over me and was wearing my 'wash-day' outfit... Also, i'm not surper sure i'll ever be bathing again so it's not like there was even an olefactory incentive there! i am doing two things right now. I am composing an post and i am also watching the collected no doubt videos. I am doing both of these things sitting at my desk in my room.
polished: Kindness of strangers... Attempted laundry today with the kids and quickly realized how the simplest tasks can become an ordeal. I also discovered how remarkably sweet strangers can be for no reason other than because they feel like it. Trust me. It wasn't like they were trying to get into my pants or anything. I was covered in kid drool and wore my 'wash-day' outfit... Also, I'm not entirely sure I'll bathe again, so it wasn't like there was any olfactory incentive! I am doing two things right now. I am composing a post and also watching the collected No Doubt videos. I am doing both of these while sitting at my desk in my room.

original: So it is 11:14pm mst, and here i sit in my bedroom fixing the personal computer of the personnel director from my job. Not that i mind doing it, but i wonder sometimes at how often i find myself fixing someone else's computer as a favour. I'm glad to be able to love and minister to people this way, but where is the line drawn where it comes to the point that you are being taken advantage of? the last couple of weeks, i've been staying up late reading and such, so i was looking forward to hitting the sack early, until i realized it would be more prudent to get this computer out of my bedroom and back into its owner's hands. *laugh* no rest for the weary, right? so i found myself watching joe schmo 2 again tonight.
polished: It's 11:14 PM MST, and here I sit in my bedroom fixing the personal computer of the personnel director from my job. I don't mind doing it, but I sometimes wonder at how often I find myself fixing someone else's computer as a favor. I'm glad to help people this way, but where is the line drawn when it comes to being taken advantage of? The last couple of weeks, I've been staying up late reading and such, so I was looking forward to an early night until I realized it would be more prudent to get this computer out of my bedroom and back to its owner. *laugh* No rest for the weary, right? So I found myself watching Joe Schmo 2 again tonight.

original: Remind me, what did i write about before this? or, a continuation in the 'is this a date?' saga so, after the weird lunch, my confidence shook, i forgot to tell you guys an important piece of the story. Before pat shows up to lunch, dustin starts talking about what a nice guy pat is and how he's trying to find a girlfriend for him. I'm listening and nodding and realizing that we're talking more about finding dustin's best friend a girl, than discussing whatever it is you discuss with a stranger over pink lemonade. I excused myself to the bathroom, looked in the mirror and then silently asked myself: am i being pawned off to the other guy? is this what happens now?
polished: Remind me, what did I write about before this? Or, a continuation in the "is this a date?" saga. So, after the weird lunch, my confidence shook. I forgot to tell you an important piece of the story. Before Pat shows up to lunch, Dustin starts talking about what a nice guy Pat is and how he's trying to find a girlfriend for him. I'm listening, nodding, and realizing that we're talking more about finding Dustin's best friend a girl than discussing whatever you discuss with a stranger over pink lemonade. I excused myself to the bathroom, looked in the mirror, and then silently asked myself: am I being pawned off to the other guy? Is this what happens now?

original: I would like everyone to think before they act. Actually.. I'd like each and every single person in the world to think before they get out of bed in the morning, and make a commitment to keep thinking all day, and if they're not prepared to, i'd like very much that they'd hop the fuck back in bed, and drift off to an eternal slumber. I'm sick to death of stupid people. No i'm not the smartest motherfucker in the world... But i'm not talking about things that take a lot of brain power, so i think its fair to persecute the inanely stupid. Lets see if i can keep this particular rant to a few particular types, and we'll save some for another day, sound good? great.
polished: I would like everyone to think before they act. In fact, I'd like every single person in the world to think before they get out of bed in the morning and commit to thinking all day. If they're not prepared to, I'd prefer they hop back into bed and drift off to an eternal slumber. I'm sick of dealing with stupid people. I'm not the smartest person in the world, but I'm not talking about things that require a lot of brain power, so I think it's fair to criticize the truly ignorant. Let's see if I can keep this rant focused on a few types, and we'll save some for another day, sound good? Great.

original: Two problems with the scenario outlined in my previous post: 1. True, bush is stimulating the economy, but in the wrong way. Urllink robert rubin told npr's marketplace today that bush could have achieved the same stimulus effect without the long term debt hangover by enacting different tax cuts, temporary tax cuts that would benefit low and middle income persons. Ah, robert rubin. The sound of his name is music to our ears. Quick: name one bush administration cabinet official on the domestic side with rubin's gravitas. Still thinking? it'll come to you... 2. We can't give the republicans control only in wartime because they've ingeniously concocted an endless, global 'war on terrorism.'
polished: Two issues arise with the scenario outlined in my previous post: 1. It's true that Bush is stimulating the economy, but in the wrong way. Robert Rubin told NPR's Marketplace today that Bush could have achieved the same stimulus effect without long-term debt by enacting different tax cuts—temporary ones benefiting low- and middle-income individuals. Ah, Robert Rubin. The sound of his name is music to our ears. Quick: can you name one Bush administration cabinet official on the domestic side with Rubin's gravitas? Still thinking? It'll come to you... 2. We can't give Republicans control only during wartime because they've ingeniously concocted an endless, global "war on terrorism.

original: 'she's saying i'm on the run, i'm chasing guys for fun' ~the offspring umm haven't updated in awhile but not much to say.. Went to the cove to see supernothing, they were good as usual, got to chill with tiago :-).. Sat. Went to work and then out w/ joe and rach, met up with steve, tiago and tom.. Came home at like quarter to 12 and woke up the next morning at quarter to 7 for a meet.. Got there a little late but it's all good, i did my full on floor and didn't fall, second on floor and vault and third on beam, 29.45 all around which isn't bad bc my meets get better as the season goes on..
polished: 'She's saying I'm on the run, chasing guys for fun' ~The Offspring. Haven't updated in a while, but not much to say. Went to the Cove to see Supernothing; they were great as usual. Got to chill with Tiago :-) Saturday, I went to work and then out with Joe and Rach, met up with Steve, Tiago, and Tom. Came home around quarter to 12 and woke up the next morning at quarter to 7 for a meet. Got there a bit late, but it's all good—I performed my full routine on the floor without falling. Secured second on floor and vault and third on beam, scoring 29.45 all around, which isn't bad since my meets improve as the season progresses.

original: Do you ever have one of those moments when you begin to reflect on life? like you're sitting in math class bored out of your skull, and you wonder what exactly goes on in your brain that makes you understand math? and you realize that you exist and you are in math class and you wonder why. Then you realize how amazing existing is. And suddenly it hits you-the fact that you are going off on this random train of thought is incredibly pathetic. Ever had that happen? i hate that. You know what else i hate? block schedules. Who would ever come up with that idea? anyone can see that sitting through a two and a half hour class in any subject is cruel and unusual punishment.
polished: Have you ever had one of those moments when you start reflecting on life? Like you're sitting in math class, bored out of your mind, and you wonder what exactly happens in your brain that helps you understand math? Then you realize you exist and you are in math class and wonder why. You understand how amazing existing is. And suddenly it hits you—the fact that you are going off on this random train of thought is incredibly pathetic. Ever experienced that? I hate it. You know what else I hate? Block schedules. Who would ever come up with that idea? Clearly, sitting through a two-and-a-half-hour class in any subject is cruel and unusual punishment.

original: I think that monpoly has run it's course in my life and i vow to never lay my hands on that damn iron (not a hot one but the piece in the game) again. Tonight andy beat me by a few small dollars and won the farquin game, or maybe i let him win on account of him leaving in a few short hours and me wanting him to feel good on his last night here. Well how ever the story goes it can't compare to this texas sized headache i have at the moment, i've taken some aleve and i must say that they are doing the trick, all i need now is some well deserved r&r your telephone's the one that helped me wrap the cord around your neck... At the drive in
polished: I think that Monopoly has run its course in my life, and I vow never to lay my hands on that iron (not a hot one but the game piece) again. Tonight, Andy beat me by a few dollars and won the game, or maybe I let him win since he's leaving in a few hours, and I wanted him to feel good on his last night here. However, the story goes, it can't compare to this Texas-sized headache I have at the moment. I've taken some Aleve, and they are doing the trick; all I need now is some well-deserved R&R... at the drive-in.

original: Well... Today's been a long day. We had to drive home from indiana. I guess i'm gonna sort of have to be choosy what i write about because i could really take up a lot of time and space and i just don't have enough energy. First off i have to say that camp was awesome and even better than i could have expected. God's been doing so much stuff in my life lately and it's just awesome. I've sort of turned over a new leaf i guess, but anyway's back to the beginning. We arrived at the twiggs' house on friday evening and we stayed until we left for camp on monday. Most of what we did was go to the fair, church, a parade, walmart and watched movies.
polished: Today's been a long day. We drove home from Indiana. I guess I'll need to be choosy about what I write because I could really take up a lot of time and space, and I don't have enough energy. First off, I have to say that camp was awesome, even better than I expected. God's been doing so much in my life lately, and it's just amazing. I've sort of turned over a new leaf, I guess. Anyway, back to the beginning. We arrived at the Twiggs' house on Friday evening and stayed until we left for camp on Monday. Most of what we did was go to the fair, church, a parade, Walmart, and watched movies.

original: Today is my last day of summer vacation! waaaaaa! and i have a dentist appointment at 9. I hate that, but i'd rather get it over with than try to schedule it during the first month of my surgery rotation. I'm definitely nervous, scared, jittery, and any other words you can think up for 'hell's no, me's don wanna go' to school. This is going to be a whole new ball game for me. As a perfectionist, i love excelling at everything i do. But starting new things is a bitch. I hate being a pawn (like i told cassie: 'i'm going to be the only pawn on the chessboard who insists on moving like a knight'), and i hate not knowing what's going on.
polished: Today is my last day of summer vacation! Waaaaaa! And I have a dentist appointment at 9. I hate that, but I'd rather get it over with than try to schedule it during the first month of my surgery rotation. I'm definitely nervous, scared, jittery, and any other words you can think up for 'hell no, I don't want to go' to school. This is going to be a whole new ball game for me. As a perfectionist, I love excelling at everything I do. But starting new things is tough. I hate being a pawn (like I told Cassie: 'I'm going to be the only pawn on the chessboard who insists on moving like a knight'), and I hate not knowing what's going on.

original: Arun shourie talks about how, the present governor of uttar pradesh had warned, as far back as 1996, about the impending threat of the rise of a urllink ' third islamic state ' in the subcontinent . T v rajeswar, the former head of the intelligence bureau and the present governor of uttar pradesh had predicted this dire threat in a series of articles published in the hindustan times, way back in 1996. Shourie raises a valid point when he says, does the fact that you now know that he, and not i, to say nothing of mr advani, wrote all that make the warnings ring true? or do you conclude that because he wrote in this refrain, t v rajeswar is a closet communalist and should not be allowed to continue as governor of uttar pradesh?
polished: Arun Shourie discusses how the current governor of Uttar Pradesh had warned, as early as 1996, about the impending threat of the rise of a "Third Islamic State" in the subcontinent. T.V. Rajeswar, the former head of the Intelligence Bureau and the current governor of Uttar Pradesh, predicted this ominous threat in a series of articles published in The Hindustan Times, way back in 1996. Shourie raises a valid point when he asks, does knowing that he, not I, nor Mr. Advani, wrote all that, make the warnings seem credible? Or do you conclude that because he expressed this concern, T.V. Rajeswar is a covert communalist and should not be allowed to continue as governor of Uttar Pradesh?

However it's good to see tigger(now akcron) taking up the reigns herself and making an appearance and talking about things :) not much to say about things, yesterday was shakespeare on the green, was a lovely play, but i had to leave before closing curtain, which kinda sucked, hopefully someday i'll see the entirety of a shakespeare play. But i digress. polished: Attitude: bored; mood: indifferent, yet looking forward to tonight. It's been a long, hard day in the trenches here today, folks—almost no time to write anything for you readers. However, it's good to see Tigger (now Akcron) taking up the reins herself, making an appearance, and discussing various topics :) Not much to say; yesterday was Shakespeare on the Green. It was a lovely play, but I had to leave before the closing curtain, which was disappointing. Hopefully, someday I'll see the entirety of a Shakespeare play. But I digress. original: All of a sudden, for the past two days, i have been overcome with terrible bouts of exhaustion. Bone dead exhaustion. Last evening, i went home, and just slept off, and only got up when my mother called me around eight thirty. And when i woke up, it was all dark, and i hadn't switched the lights on, so i could not figure out what time or date it was, for a few seconds, it was just my mother's voice in the darkness and me grappling with reality. Wonder why i'm feeling so drained... Nice weather this morning. It was drizzling when i came. Although in calcutta i hear it's been raining for the past three days.
polished: All of a sudden, over the past two days, I have been plagued by immense exhaustion. Bone-deep exhaustion. Last evening, I went home, fell asleep immediately, and only woke when my mother called me around eight thirty. When I woke up, it was completely dark since I hadn't turned on the lights, leaving me disoriented about the time or date; for a few moments, it was just my mother's voice piercing the darkness while I grappled with reality. I wonder why I'm feeling so drained… The weather this morning is pleasant. It was drizzling when I arrived, although I've heard that in Calcutta, it's been raining for the past three days.

original: Last night was the worst. I threw away the sweater i was knitting. I only had about 14 inches. I lost probably $10 worth of yarn (it's $8 a skein). But it had too many stitches by the time i got to the arm holes and the mohair was knotting itself together as i knitted, so frogging (ripping out rows) didn't work well. The yarn broke a lot. I didn't even swear, which is unusual for me. I just morosely ripped and listened to season two of sex and the city (way to go, library!). And then i got sick of it and threw it away. I suppose i could say i learned a lot while trying to do this sweater.
polished: Last night was the worst. I discarded the sweater I was knitting. I only had about 14 inches done and lost approximately $10 worth of yarn (it's $8 a skein). It ended up with too many stitches by the time I reached the armholes, and the mohair tangled itself as I knitted, so frogging (ripping out rows) was ineffective. The yarn frequently broke. I didn't even swear, which is unusual for me. I just morosely unraveled it and listened to season two of Sex and the City (thanks, library!). Eventually, I got fed up and threw it away. I guess I could say I learned a lot while attempting this sweater.

original: Last night in class, we were discussing that week’s assigned reading, urllink getting back into place: toward a renewed study of the place-world, by edward s. Casey . The first chapter deals with “implacement” and the second, “displacement.” in the first chapter, casey makes the distinction that our contemporary world and culture revolves around time as the situating force: we are running out of time, we have saved time, we are just in time. He is trying to make the case that using place as the center of culture gives a more grounded community. (that is a very rough summation, a disclaimer just in case my professor or any other classmate happens to read this post.) so far, this book is the first reading that has grabbed me by the proverbial shoulders.
polished: Last night in class, we discussed the week's assigned reading, "Getting Back into Place: Toward a Renewed Study of the Place-World," by Edward S. Casey. The first chapter explores “implacement” and the second, “displacement.” In the initial chapter, Casey distinguishes how our contemporary world and culture revolve around time as the central force: we are running out of time, we have saved time, we are just in time. He argues that centering culture around place could foster a more grounded community. (This is a rough summation, a disclaimer in case my professor or any classmates read this post.) So far, this book is the first reading that has truly engaged me.

original: Whatever it is they put into freeze pops to make them those colours, there should be some sort of warning: may make your life a bit bizarre. And whilst giggling is good, one wonders if we would have found ourselves up that fire escape drinking beer in the fierce wind had we not been eating them earlier. Finding ourselves in a doorway to a bar sadly closed for business, we stopped to examine an office-supplies catalogue that had arrived in the post. Lucky we did. Who could possibly have guessed that within these pages were the special offers of a lifetime? not i, for certain. I list but a few: buy 36 permanent marker pens, get a stunt kite. Buy 30 lever arch files, get a barbecue.

original: Currently listening to: the little drummer boy by stevan pasero ...and now my post... Senate republicans okay, hands up - who watched the 39-hour judicial nominations wankathon last week? i know i didn't. Well, okay - i did tune in once or twice. The entire colossal waste of time was perpetrated by republicans who, pissed off that democrats wouldn't roll over and nominate four of bush's nutjob justices, were trying to score political points by holding a multi-day cry-fest. Never mind the fact that the democrats have already approved 168 of bush's judicial nominees - nooo, that's not good enough for the power-mad republicans who are for some reason laboring under the misapprehension they have a huge mandate for this kind of nonsense.
polished: Currently listening to: "The Little Drummer Boy" by Stevan Pasero. And now my post: Senate Republicans, okay, hands up—who watched the 39-hour judicial nominations debate last week? I know I didn't. Well, okay, I did tune in once or twice. The entire waste of time was orchestrated by Republicans, upset that Democrats wouldn't concede and nominate four of Bush's extreme justices, trying to gain political points by holding a multi-day protest. Never mind the fact that Democrats have already approved 168 of Bush's judicial nominees—no, that's not good enough for power-hungry Republicans who, for some reason, are under the false impression they have a huge mandate for this nonsense.

original: This was a good weekend. I did a lot of god's green leaf, after a long time, i listened to a lot of nevermore (something i should have started doing much earlier) and read a lot. I finished three books over the weekend - bruce sterling's heavy weather, larry niven's world of ptavvs and octavia butler's parable of the sower. Heavy weather was a good cyberpunk romp through a near-future usa, devastated by global warming and general anarchy. While it was clever, well-paced and altogether very convincing, i must confess that i failed to come away with any really significant sensations about the story or the characters. Not that both aren't well constructed and vividly etched - it's a good book, but not a great one, i guess.
polished: This was a great weekend. I indulged in much of God's green leaf, and after a while, I listened extensively to Nevermore, something I should have done sooner. I also read a lot, finishing three books: Bruce Sterling's "Heavy Weather," Larry Niven's "World of Ptavvs," and Octavia Butler's "Parable of the Sower." "Heavy Weather" offered a thrilling cyberpunk exploration of a near-future USA, ravaged by global warming and anarchy. While it was clever, well-paced, and convincing, I must admit that I didn't experience any truly significant emotional impact from the story or characters. Not that they aren't well-constructed and vividly depicted—it's a good book, but not a great one, I suppose.

original: Coz' this is the aftermath the first week back from practicum was a struggle but it is only in the second week that the smoke has really started to clear. Post-practicum trauma was a hidden epidemic that is only now coming to light. I was stricken but with the eventual meeting with the course co-ordinator allowed me to release my burden and by doing so i have prevented another person being stuck with such a pedagogically deficit practicum school. Yesterday (monday) i bumped into another agrieved classmate who was quite determined to go to the student who was due to go to her school in the next practicum and tell him how terrible it will be. I calmed her down and said that we should go to the administrator first.
polished: The first week back from practicum was a struggle, but it's only in the second week that the smoke has truly started to clear. Post-practicum trauma was a hidden epidemic that is only now coming to light. I was stricken, but the eventual meeting with the course coordinator allowed me to release my burden. By doing so, I have prevented another person from being stuck with such a pedagogically deficient practicum school. Yesterday (Monday), I bumped into another aggrieved classmate who was determined to warn the student assigned to her previous practicum school about its challenges. I calmed her down, suggesting that we should approach the administrator first.

original: Well, things are incredibly busy here at times...but there's always time for supposed stress relieving activities. I've found that i really suck at 8-ball and ping pong! rick(the canuck) beats my ass on a regular basis - we have a ping pong table in the front lobby of our building, always time for a 'quick round'. Last night i participated in an 8-ball tournament over at the hot spot (our recreation tent - complete with popcorn machine, numerous tv's, jukebox, dvd rental, pool table, dart board, and ever present ping pong table). Anyway, i was doing pretty well throughout my one entire game - until i scratched on the eight ball ;( i still had a fairly good time - the most fun was the two dutch soldiers that joined in the tournament.
polished: Well, things can get incredibly busy here at times, but there's always time for activities meant to relieve stress. I've discovered that I'm not very good at 8-ball and ping pong! Rick (the Canuck) beats me regularly—we have a ping pong table in the front lobby of our building, so there's always time for a "quick round." Last night, I participated in an 8-ball tournament at the hot spot (our recreation tent), which is complete with a popcorn machine, numerous TVs, a jukebox, DVD rental, pool table, dart board, and the ever-present ping pong table. I was doing pretty well throughout my one entire game until I scratched on the eight ball. I still had a good time—the highlight was the two Dutch soldiers who joined in the tournament.

original: Fall 1974: i was attempting for what felt like the 13th time to fight my way through the second chapter of my high school algebra book. I was not then nor am i now a math person. I hate math. I am math phobic. You get the picture. So as i struggled to make sense out of algebra the doorbell rang. I put down my book and went to open the door. No one was there. Great. I returned to my studies and just as i was finding a little glimmer of understanding buried in my sub conscious the doorbell rang again. Bam, just like that my breakthrough disappeared. I went to the door and once again no one was there. Just what a struggling math student needs, an uninvited practical joker.
polished: Fall 1974: I was attempting for what felt like the 13th time to battle through the second chapter of my high school algebra book. I was not then, nor am I now, a math person. I hate math. I am math phobic. You get the picture. As I struggled to make sense of algebra, the doorbell rang. I put down my book and went to open the door. No one was there. Great. I returned to my studies, and just as I was finding a glimmer of understanding buried in my subconscious, the doorbell rang again. Bam, just like that, my breakthrough disappeared. I went to the door, and once again, no one was there. Just what a struggling math student needs—an uninvited practical joker.

original: This past week has been nothing short of exhausting. I spent tuesday-thursday finishing the move to my new classroom. The new room is bigger and closer to my grade level team, these are the things i need to consider as i spend hours upon hours preparing my room for this year. Had i known i was going to move prior to the end of my school year, i would have discarded much of the books and supplies i no longer use. Unfortunately, it all came with me. So this week was spent moving, unpacking, and purging profusely. I have to thank my teammate jill for helping with all of this. You see, she was still teaching this month, in my old room. So she and her lovely students moved almost my entire room for me!
polished: This past week has been nothing short of exhausting. I spent Tuesday to Thursday completing the move to my new classroom. The new room is bigger and closer to my grade level team, which are important factors as I spend hours preparing my room for this year. Had I known I would be moving before the end of the school year, I would have discarded many books and supplies I no longer use. Unfortunately, everything came with me. So, this week was spent moving, unpacking, and purging extensively. I must thank my teammate Jill for her help. She was still teaching this month, in my old room, so she and her wonderful students moved almost my entire room for me!

original: You can't help it, you can't evade it: a piece of you will always live in me. Even if i never carried you child, even if i was never married to you, even if i was never an official pair to you ... I loved you immensely, and to this day the feeling carries an echo through my heart. Forever will i always be reminded of the very few nights we spent together, hearts and limbs entwined in a soul-embrace, drenched in the salty darkness of an evening by the beach ... Or a kiss under the rain. Whenever i get the feeling of a dark glass puncturing my heart, you will be there. That piece of you... Bleeding the eternal love that once lived in me ... And still remains. .. For heri
polished: You can't help it, you can't evade it: a part of you will always live in me. Even if I never carried your child, even if I was never married to you, even if I was never officially with you... I loved you deeply, and to this day, the feeling echoes through my heart. Forever will I be reminded of the few nights we spent together, hearts and limbs entwined in a soul-embrace, drenched in the salty darkness of an evening by the beach... or a kiss under the rain. Whenever I feel as though a dark glass is piercing my heart, you will be there. That part of you... Bleeding the eternal love that once lived in me... and still remains. .. For heri.

original: I'm uncomfortable. Investigative reporting seems very wrong to me. Or let me rephrase that, the article i'm doing and it's consequences is not exactly something i'm comfortable with. Perhaps it is because i don't believe in it enough, that i cannot really get the complete feel for it. The angst behind it. The full-out passion towards it to question. I've grown up in a country where you don't ask questions. Really, you just don't. They shoot you for that shit. They put you in jail with all these internal security acts. I am not used to this freedom of speech...not used to questioning out loud. Sure, i am not the easiest person to get along with.
polished: I'm uncomfortable. Investigative reporting seems very wrong to me. Or let me rephrase that, the article I'm doing and its consequences are not exactly something I'm comfortable with. Perhaps it is because I don't believe in it enough to truly understand its full complexity. The angst behind it. The full-out passion towards it to question. I've grown up in a country where you don't ask questions. Really, you just don't. They punish you for that. They imprison you under all these internal security acts. I am not used to this freedom of speech...not used to questioning out loud. Sure, I am not the easiest person to get along with.

original: We had an outing yesterday with my co-employees at the bank. We went to guintubdan, la carolota. It was the first time for most of us. We trekked for the falls. It was a 30 minute or so walk. We were all catching our breaths. Whew! but we made it. The water was chilly ice. You can feel your body getting numb because of the coldness. We only stayed less than an hour because we headed for the nearby waterfalls. Another 30 minutes of trekking. But the trip was worth it because the falls looked calming and the whole scene is indeed breathtaking. Its like you can hear yourself being one with nature. Soaking myself in the cold water was like communing with mother earth. The cold air and water were enough to make you be lulled to sleep.
polished: We had an outing yesterday with my colleagues from the bank. We went to Guintubdan, La Carolota, a new experience for most of us. We trekked to the falls, a 30-minute walk that left us breathless. Whew! But we made it. The water was icy, numbing us with its chill. We stayed less than an hour before heading to the nearby waterfalls, another 30 minutes of trekking. The trip was worth it because the falls looked calming, and the whole scene was breathtaking. It felt like becoming one with nature. Soaking in the cold water was like communing with Mother Earth. The chill of the air and water was enough to lull us into serenity.

original: Well i am sure my sisters are drunk off their butts. Today was pride in san diego. I know my sisters and when it is drinking time, it is drinking time. It is the one thing i didn't get from the buenviajes, the want to drink. There are few times i don't mind drinking but let's just say they are very rare times. So we have a month left before ed leaves. I think it is starting to sink in with ed and with all of us. I think it sunk in with me a long time ago. I just hope that ed will be here for bailey's surgery. We have been keeping an eye on his swelling and there definitely is quite a bit of swelling.
polished: I am sure my sisters are quite drunk right now. Today was Pride in San Diego. I know my sisters, and when it's drinking time, it's really drinking time. The desire to drink is something I didn’t inherit from the Buenviajes. There are few occasions when I don’t mind drinking, but let's say they are particularly rare. We have a month left before Ed leaves, and I think it's starting to sink in with Ed and all of us. I believe it hit me a while ago. I just hope Ed will be here for Bailey's surgery. We've been monitoring Bailey's swelling, and there is certainly quite a bit of swelling.

original: Saturday we took connor to firemans park, thinking that the fireman's easter egg hunt was to start at 11am. It turned out it was on the friday. Thank goodness i brought a bag of eggs with me just incase. So connor had a great time finding eggs out in the park. Sunday morning when he woke up he was so excited that the easter bunny had come. There is nothing better then to see the excitement on your childs face. After egg hunting, we all went to church. Even though the 'easter bunny' is fun and all. We do make sure our kids know the true meaning of the holidays. This was megan's first easter, she looked so cute dressed in her jean dress and stockings :)
polished: On Saturday, we took Connor to Fireman's Park, thinking the Easter egg hunt started at 11 AM. It turned out it was actually on Friday. Thankfully, I brought a bag of eggs with me just in case. Connor had a great time finding eggs in the park. Sunday morning, when he woke up, he was thrilled to discover the Easter Bunny had come. There is nothing better than seeing the excitement on your child's face. After egg hunting, we all went to church. While the "Easter Bunny" is fun, we ensure our kids know the true meaning of the holidays. This was Megan's first Easter, and she looked adorable in her jean dress and stockings.

original: I know in a previous post i protected parents, almost even taking their side, well here's my little change of mind. Parents don't know anything. They think they know you soooo well, maybe even to the point where they can read emotions off your face. They can't. Parents know nothing about us. And when i go upstairs after arguing with nicole about kelli, like i just did a few minutes ago, and they want me to tell them what's wrong. Yeah, how about you shut the fuck up!? i don't have to tell you what's wrong all the time. Here's the situation with nicole and kelli. Kelli and nicole don't like each other. At all.
polished: In a previous post, I defended parents, almost siding with them, but I've had a change of heart. Parents don't actually understand us as well as they think. They assume they can read our emotions, but they can't. After arguing with Nicole about Kelli, like I just did a few minutes ago, they ask me what's wrong. Honestly, sometimes I just need them to give me space. I don't have to explain everything. Here's the situation with Nicole and Kelli: they don't get along at all.

original: Urllink some people are jumping to connect urllink this dot : the urllink organization for security and cooperation in europe was invited to monitor the election by the state department. The observers will come from the osce's office for democratic institutions and human rights. It will be the first time such a team has been present for a u.s. Presidential election. With urllink this dot : a baker's dozen of congressional democrats, among them four new yorkers, has petitioned u.n. Secretary- general kofi annan to dispatch international observers to florida to oversee this year's presidential balloting there. I humbly disagree. Based on the info available, the osce seems to be coming here to learn from the u.s. Election process, not to oversee it, which was the original partisan and childish call for u.n.
polished: Some people are eager to connect this dot: the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe was invited to monitor the election by the State Department. The observers will be from the OSCE's Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights. It will be the first time such a team has been present for a U.S. presidential election. Alongside this dot: a group of thirteen congressional Democrats, among them four New Yorkers, has petitioned U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan to send international observers to Florida to oversee this year's presidential balloting there. I respectfully disagree. Based on the information available, the OSCE seems to be coming here to learn from the U.S. election process, not to oversee it, which was the original partisan and immature call for U.N. involvement.

original: Gop gets scolded on recruitment naturalization ceremonies in jacksonville are to be relocated after complaints that gop activists registered new citizens as republicans. By gary fineout and alfonso chardy the citizenship ceremony in jacksonville seemed to go off as usual, with a crowd of nearly 200 people going home as new americans. Just before the new citizens left the june 29 event, an immigration official directing the swearing-in urged them to stop by a voter registration table -- a not uncommon sight at naturalization ceremonies. But this table was unusual: those handing out forms were republican volunteers -- and the party affiliation box had been checked off ahead of time to make all of the new voters members of the gop. All of it was suspicious to linda cross, who was there to watch her husband, dario cruz, take his citizenship oath.
polished: GOP gets scolded on recruitment. Naturalization ceremonies in Jacksonville are being relocated after complaints that GOP activists registered new citizens as Republicans. By Gary Fineout and Alfonso Chardy. The citizenship ceremony in Jacksonville proceeded as usual, with a crowd of nearly 200 people going home as new Americans. Just before the new citizens left the June 29 event, an immigration official conducting the swearing-in urged them to visit a voter registration table—a common sight at naturalization ceremonies. However, this table was unusual: those distributing forms were Republican volunteers, and the party affiliation box had been premarked to enroll all the new voters as GOP members. All of this appeared suspicious to Linda Cross, who was present to witness her husband, Dario Cruz, take his citizenship oath.

original: I have always prided myself in making anyone that frequents casa pescatore as comforable as possible. I want them to make sure they feel at home as they will feel in their prospective residence. Yesterday- i hope i succeeded. The masses all congregated on perry ave with what many consider ' extreme prejudice'. 4:30pm was the time my best friend eric and his son nunu came over with a huge pan of baked ziti. The tables were set and i had all the food that i cooked and the bells were ringing crazy. Before i could blink - my best friend from florida walked through the door and that made me smile. I missed that motherfucker so much. The bonus was him bringing his wife along. She is expecting and this is the closest i could get to being an uncle. I spoiled that girl with tray after tray of food and tiramisu.
polished: I have always prided myself on making anyone who frequents Casa Pescatore as comfortable as possible. I want them to feel at home, just as they would in their residence. Yesterday, I hope I succeeded. The crowd gathered on Perry Ave with what many consider "extreme prejudice." At 4:30 PM, my best friend Eric and his son Nunu came over with a huge pan of baked ziti. The tables were set, and I had all the food I cooked ready to serve, with the bells ringing wildly. Before I knew it, my best friend from Florida walked through the door, bringing a big smile to my face. I missed him so much. The bonus was him bringing his wife along. She's expecting, and this is the closest I could get to being an uncle. I spoiled her with tray after tray of food and tiramisu.

original: I liked the idea of that as an offence - maybe that could've been a way out of being burned as a witch. As a non-american blogger i've been a little reluctant to get involved in some of these discussions, particularly the bits about flags, but since i started it (the subject, not the flag-burning) i suppose i'd better say something. Firstly, i think that the idea of having a law against flag-burning is completely nuts. The moment you start according a symbol - any symbol - that kind of automatic reverence and protection, you've taken a small but important step towards totalitarianism. Symbols are kind of fickle - they don't a priori represent anything in themselves; it's what they are perceived as meaning or made to represent that's important.
polished: I liked the idea of that as an offense—perhaps it could have been a way out of being burned as a witch. As a non-American blogger, I've been a bit hesitant to engage in some of these discussions, particularly about flags, but since I initiated it (the subject, not the flag-burning), I should say something. Firstly, I believe that having a law against flag-burning is completely irrational. The moment you start according a symbol—any symbol—that kind of automatic reverence and protection, you've taken a small yet important step towards totalitarianism. Symbols are quite fickle—they don't inherently represent anything in themselves; it's what they are perceived as meaning or made to represent that's significant.

original: Holla so i saw troy tonight with my family...i was not impressed. I'm too tired to go way into specifics, but i do think it had potential. However, i think too much energy was spent on the set (which was magnificent) and not enough on creating a solidifying tone, theme, etc. It retold the story, but it was not particularly gripping, and i don't feel like i gained anything from watching it. The character development was rather weak. Additionally, i thought the score was poor, and was basically a knock-off of the gladiator. The gladiator used the background music of a moaning woman and it worked b/c it backed up and complemented a genuinely gripping narrative.
polished: Hello, I saw Troy tonight with my family, and I was not impressed. I'm too tired to delve into specifics, but I felt it had potential. However, too much energy was spent on the set (which was magnificent) and not enough on establishing a solid tone, theme, etc. It retold the story, but it wasn't particularly gripping, and I don't feel like I gained anything from it. The character development was quite weak. Furthermore, I thought the score was poor and essentially a knock-off of Gladiator. Gladiator used the background music of a moaning woman, which worked because it supported and complemented a genuinely compelling narrative.

It seems to offer a lot of native app goodness. It's important to note that it is not free, which seems to be a hot topic online recently. You can try it for 15 days and then switch to something else, or pay $25 if you decide you like it. A standout feature is that each post is its own entity, which can be moved, stored, labeled, and even deleted. I can easily see how this would delight news tracker enthusiasts. It imports and exports OPML, as expected.

original: Today... I miss my sister terribly - it just seems strange not to have her hanging around, irritating me (just joking...). Even though it was only for a week, she really made her presence felt, and i mean that in a good way. Just doing the scrapbook for our trtip to tasmania brings fond memories of a time past recently - last week in fact. Maybe it's just the thought that i won't see her for quite a while - with her going to bristol in sept/oct and all. She represented, on a deeper level, a link to my family back home. Oh how i miss them all. Tomorrow is the start of a new term. How did the holidays fly by so quickly?
polished: Today, I miss my sister terribly—it’s strange not to have her around, teasing me (just joking...). Even though it was only for a week, she truly made her presence felt, and I mean that in a good way. Creating the scrapbook for our trip to Tasmania brings fond memories of last week. Maybe it's just the thought that I won't see her for quite a while—with her going to Bristol in September/October and all. She represented, on a deeper level, a link to my family back home. Oh, how I miss them all. Tomorrow is the start of a new term. How did the holidays fly by so quickly?

original: Ever have one of those days when you just don't know what the... What the... Anything? no? well then you should skip the rest of this because it won't make any sense to you. To those of you choosing to continue on i offer the following observation. ' sometimes i wish i'd been given the manual .' manuals, if done correctly at least, let you know: what things are for, what they can do, how they do the things they do, what happens if you push button x or y, what to do if things aren't doing what they're supposed to the phone number and email address of the omniscient guru who can solve every problem very useful information. Unfortunately i didn't get a manual with me.
polished: Ever have one of those days when you just don't know what the... What the... Anything? No? Well, then you should skip the rest of this because it won't make any sense to you. To those choosing to continue, I offer the following observation: "Sometimes I wish I'd been given the manual." Manuals, if done correctly at least, let you know what things are for, what they can do, how they do it, what happens if you push button X or Y, what to do if things aren't working as expected, and give you the contact information of the omniscient guru who can solve every problem—very useful information. Unfortunately, I didn't get a manual with me.

original: And there's nothing wrong with pcs -- if i were a full-bore gamer with time to do such a thing, i'd certainly have a pc system for the wealth of available games. Though except for a few unique products, that huge wall of games at compusa starts getting repetetive after a while -- at first i'm envious, then i start noticing that it's really just a lot of different flavors of the same soda...first-person shooters, mystery games, strategy games, simulations. There are so many variations of age of empires it becomes comical. Aoe -- with orcs! aoe -- with spaceships! aoe -- with fuzzy wombats! it's like the endless movie trailers that begin with the line: 'in a world...'
polished: There's nothing wrong with PCs—if I were an avid gamer with the time, I'd certainly have a system for the vast array of games available. Though, except for a few unique titles, that massive selection at CompUSA becomes repetitive after a while. Initially, I'm envious, but then I notice it's just different flavors of the same soda... first-person shooters, mystery games, strategy games, simulations. The sheer number of Age of Empires variations is almost comical. AOE with orcs! AOE with spaceships! AOE with fuzzy wombats! It's like the endless movie trailers that begin with "In a world...

original: Lblair (non-privileged).pst -----original message----- from: threet, kay sent: thursday, june 28, 2001 11:08 am to: blair, lynn cc: stevens, bob; neville, sue; cabrera, reyna subject: nsp powerpac issues lynn, following our discussion yesterday afternoon, reyna and i came back and reviewed the nsp powerpac agreement. We were specifically looking for language in this agreement which may require us to true up for the customer regardless of whether or not we were allocating storage on a given gas day. We couldn’t locate any language in the current agreement (dated April 1, 2001) that obligates us to do so, but perhaps we overlooked or misinterpreted something.

original: Jdasovic.nsf monday, december 11, 2000 to: all px market participants from: john yurkanin chief operating officer re: loss of continuity in px day ahead auction due to iso rule changes the emergency tariff filing by the california iso last friday has had a negative effect on the px day ahead auction market. The mixture of soft and hard caps results in a complete disconnect and unacceptable risk to all of our participants and will probably not provide the iso with its sought after reduction in real time energy sales and procurement. The overall effect will be that supply will still defer to the higher realized price opportunity the iso offers. The px is petitioning terry winter of the iso to immediately allow for adjustment bids on any submitted schedule at any price relevant.
polished:
Jdasovic.nsf Monday, December 11, 2000  
To: All PX Market Participants  
From: John Yurkanin, Chief Operating Officer  
Re: Loss of Continuity in PX Day Ahead Auction Due to ISO Rule Changes  

The emergency tariff filing by the California ISO last Friday has negatively impacted the PX Day Ahead Auction Market. The combination of soft and hard caps results in a total disconnect and unacceptable risk to all participants and will likely not provide the ISO with the desired reduction in real-time energy sales and procurement. The overall effect will be that supply will still defer to the higher realized price opportunity the ISO offers. The PX is petitioning Terry Winter of the ISO to immediately allow adjustment bids on any submitted schedule at any relevant price.

original: Mark guzman 6-28-02.nsf just wanted to make sure you saw this from les rawson concerning grays harbor and willamette. -bill beginning immediately enron has purchased control area reserves service from bpa. The allows services to sell unit contingent energy as hourly firm since bpa is suppling reserves for up to 60 minutes. If grays harbor paper notifies rt of a unit derate or outage rt should notify bpa dispatch immediately and make the reduction in the schedule during the next ramp. For example should grays unit trip as 1333 rt would notify bpa and the sink that across the top of the hour for 1400 the schedule would be taken to zero for he 1400. The bottom line is that 60 minutes is the maximum time bpa will carry the schedule.
polished: Mark Guzman 6-28-02.nsf just wanted to ensure you saw this from Les Rawson concerning Grays Harbor and Willamette. -Bill. Beginning immediately, Enron has purchased control area reserves service from BPA. This allows services to sell unit contingent energy as hourly firm since BPA is supplying reserves for up to 60 minutes. If Grays Harbor Paper notifies RT of a unit derate or outage, RT should notify BPA dispatch immediately and reduce the schedule during the next ramp. For example, if Grays unit trips at 13:33, RT would notify BPA and the sink that by the top of the hour for 14:00, the schedule would be taken to zero for HE 14:00. The bottom line is that 60 minutes is the maximum time BPA will maintain the schedule.

original: Khyatt (non-privileged).pst el paso tests market for mainline expansion el paso natural gas apparently got the message when its last open season for 1.2 bcf/d of firm transportation capacity attracted bids for 14.4 bcf/d. The pipeline has announced an open season to test market interest in a mainline expansion and to satisfy regulatory concerns that something needs to be done to relieve the apparent capacity constraint at the california border. El paso has been under significant pressure from regulators and shippers to expand because of enormous demand and skyrocketing prices in california. In a jan. 3 letter to the pipeline, daniel m. Adamson, director of ferc's office of energy projects, urged el paso to consider modifying its line 2000 project to "assist the difficult situation" now facing the california gas market.
polished: Khyatt (non-privileged).pst El Paso tests market for mainline expansion. El Paso Natural Gas apparently got the message when its last open season for 1.2 bcf/d of firm transportation capacity attracted bids for 14.4 bcf/d. The pipeline has announced an open season to test market interest in a mainline expansion and to satisfy regulatory concerns that something needs to be done to relieve the apparent capacity constraint at the California border. El Paso has been under significant pressure from regulators and shippers to expand because of enormous demand and skyrocketing prices in California. In a Jan. 3 letter to the pipeline, Daniel M. Adamson, Director of FERC's Office of Energy Projects, urged El Paso to consider modifying its Line 2000 project to "assist the difficult situation" now facing the California gas market.

original: Sscott5.nsf ahimsa (uh-him-sah) noun the principle of noninjury to living beings. [sanskrit ahimsa : a-, not + himsa, injury (from himsati, he injures).] "as my conception of ahimsa went on maturing, i became more vigilant about my thought and speech. The lines in the anthem: scatter her enemies and make them fall; confound their policies, frustrate their knavish tricks particularly jarred upon my sentiments of ahimsa." m.k. Gandhi, the story of my experiments with truth, 1927. Today is october 2, the day mohandas karamchand gandhi was born in the year 1869. A man born some two centuries ago may appear irrelevant to our age, but in reality his life and message are still applicable to our lives today.

[Sanskrit ahimsa: a-, not + himsa, injury (from himsati, he injures).] "As my conception of ahimsa matured, I became more vigilant about my thoughts and speech. The lines in the anthem: scatter her enemies and make them fall; confound their policies, frustrate their knavish tricks particularly jarred upon my sentiments of ahimsa." M.K. Gandhi, The Story of My Experiments with Truth, 1927. Today is October 2, the day Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi was born in 1869. A man born over two centuries ago may appear irrelevant to our age, but his life and message are still applicable today.

original: Mgrigsb.nsf ? over the weekend, gov. Davis and senate polance made an informal agreement whereby senate polance has agreed to sponsor the socal mou bill. Polanco is a democrat and is currently suffering through a personal scandal and as a result, it is reported that his political career is essential dead. Polance is planning to run for mayor of los angeles rather than run for another senate term. ? the bill is expected to be introduced in the new extraordinary session, beginning today or tomorrow. The bill would first go to the senate energy committee. Sen. Bowen, the chair of the committee, strongly opposes the mou, so the bill is expected to remain in committee hearings for some time. The longer the bill is involved in committee politics and changes are made, the likelihood of a socal bankruptcy increases.
polished: Mgrigsb.nsf? Over the weekend, Gov. Davis and Senate member Polanco reached an informal agreement where Polanco agreed to sponsor the SoCal MOU bill. Polanco, a Democrat, is currently embroiled in a personal scandal, and as a result, it is reported that his political career is essentially over. Polanco plans to run for mayor of Los Angeles rather than seeking another Senate term. The bill is expected to be introduced in the new extraordinary session, beginning today or tomorrow. Initially, it will be referred to the Senate Energy Committee. Sen. Bowen, the committee chair, strongly opposes the MOU, so the bill is expected to remain in committee hearings for a prolonged period. The longer the bill is mired in committee politics and changes occur, the likelihood of a SoCal bankruptcy increases.

original: Sshackle.nsf notice no. 00-338 october 3, 2000 memorandum to: all nymex and comex members from: neal l. Wolkoff, executive vice president date: october 3, 2000 re: notice of cftc approval of new nymex rule 6.40c: ("average price calculations by futures commission merchants") please be advised that the cftc has approved new nymex rule 6.40c ("average price calculations by futures commission merchants"), which is attached and is now in effect. New nymex rule 6.40c, which is consistent with a recent cftc "advisory," permits fcms, under certain conditions specified in the rule, to use their own internal, proprietary systems to generate average price ("ap") calculations when multiple prices are received on an order or series of orders.
polished:
Shackle.nsf Notice No. 00-338  
October 3, 2000

Memorandum To: All NYMEX and COMEX Members  
From: Neal L. Wolkoff, Executive Vice President  
Date: October 3, 2000  

Re: Notice of CFTC Approval of New NYMEX Rule 6.40C: ("Average Price Calculations by Futures Commission Merchants")  

Please be advised that the CFTC has approved new NYMEX Rule 6.40C ("Average Price Calculations by Futures Commission Merchants"), which is attached and now in effect. New NYMEX Rule 6.40C, consistent with a recent CFTC "Advisory," permits FCMs, under certain conditions specified in the rule, to use their own proprietary systems to generate average price ("AP") calculations when multiple prices are received on an order or series of orders.

original: Kwatson (non-privileged).pst hello kim, my name is joelene whittaker and i am a recruiter with stm associates. Dte energy, www.dtecs.com/sitemap.html, has retained us to assist them in placing two director of sales for eastern and western regions. The eastern position will be located in ann arbor, michigan and the western position in denver, colorado. Both director of sales will report to the vice president of sales. Qualifications of this position include a minimum of 5 years of sales experience and an additional minimum of 2 years experience with a trading company is preferred. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of u.s. Coal, transportation and electric utility industries, including coal tolling, marketing and origination functions used in support of coal trading operations.
polished:
Hello Kim,

My name is Joelene Whittaker, and I am a recruiter with STM Associates. DTE Energy has engaged our services to assist in filling two Director of Sales positions for the eastern and western regions. The eastern role will be located in Ann Arbor, Michigan, and the western role in Denver, Colorado. Both Directors of Sales will report to the Vice President of Sales. Qualifications include a minimum of 5 years of sales experience, with an additional 2 years in a trading company preferred. The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of U.S. coal, transportation, and electric utility industries, including coal tolling, marketing, and origination functions for coal trading operations.

original: Sshackle.nsf as of this week enrononline has just started offering us/canadian dollar swaps online. As part of my review in determining whether a counterparty can transact these products online i look at the financial trading agreement database to see if there are any restrictions indicated, check the master swap agreement, and i am also looking at any board resolutions we might have received when we got the master agreement executed. What i am finding is that in the old days when we asked for resolutions evidencing the authority to enter into the master agreement/derivative transactions frequently the resolutions do not allow the counterparies to enter into currency transactions. Since transacting these currency transactions with our energy customers is a new area of business for us i just wanted us all to be mindful to check these old resolutions and not to rely solely on the "restrictions" contained in lotus notes.
polished: Shackle.nsf this week, EnronOnline has begun offering US/Canadian dollar swaps online. In my review to determine whether a counterparty can conduct these transactions online, I examine the financial trading agreement database for any restrictions, check the master swap agreement, and also review any board resolutions received when the master agreement was executed. What I am finding is that in the past, when we requested resolutions evidencing the authority to enter into the master agreement/derivative transactions, the resolutions often did not permit counterparties to enter into currency transactions. Since engaging in these currency transactions with our energy customers is a new business area for us, I wanted us all to be mindful to check these old resolutions and not to rely solely on the "restrictions" contained in Lotus Notes.

original: Dhyvl.nsf dave, i will be glad to generate the form of transaction agreement; however, i have a number of questions. 1. Relationship of delivery point and the use of interruptible transport on northwest pipeline. Is the transport upstream or downstream of the delivery point? if downstream, why isn't it being contracted for by eweb. 2. What volume is being sold each day. You use the term dcq and you also talk about a 20% tolerance above or below the estimated quantity. Normally their would be no tolerance with a dcq transaction. 3. Is this envisioned to be a requirements transaction. Is the price the same for volumes in excess of the estimated quantity up to an additional 20%.
polished: Dhyvl.nsf Dave, I will be glad to generate the transaction agreement form; however, I have several questions. 1. What is the relationship between the delivery point and the use of interruptible transport on the Northwest Pipeline? Is the transport upstream or downstream from the delivery point? If downstream, why isn't EWEB contracting it? 2. What volume is being sold each day? You mention DCQ and also refer to a 20% tolerance above or below the estimated quantity. Normally, there would be no tolerance with a DCQ transaction. 3. Is this intended to be a requirements transaction? Is the price the same for volumes exceeding the estimated quantity by up to an additional 20%?

original: Jdasovic.nsf the spreadsheet below gives the implicit commodity based on the effective date of four different rates for the same rate schedule (schedule dr). The rate schedule effective august 2000 through september 2000 yields a much larger commodity charge because sdg&e customers will receive a lump sum reimbursement from sdg&e over those two months. Sdg&e customers will expect lower electric bills. Assuming that the lump sum reimbursement is not included in the implicit energy component, the average for june 2000 through january 2001 is 6.2 cts and the implicit commodity average from february 2001 through december 2001 is 7.3 cts. The average implicit commodity from june 2000 through december 2001 is 6.9 cts for deliveries starting september 1, 2000, the average would still be 6.9 cts.
polished: The spreadsheet below displays the implicit commodity based on the effective dates of four different rates under the same rate schedule (Schedule DR). The rate schedule effective August 2000 through September 2000 results in a significantly larger commodity charge because SDG&E customers receive a lump sum reimbursement from SDG&E during these months. SDG&E customers can anticipate lower electric bills. Assuming that the lump sum reimbursement is excluded from the implicit energy component, the average for June 2000 through January 2001 is 6.2 cts, and the implicit commodity average from February 2001 through December 2001 is 7.3 cts. The average implicit commodity from June 2000 through December 2001 is 6.9 cts. For deliveries starting September 1, 2000, the average remains 6.9 cts.

original: Tdonoho (non-privileged).pst this has been a tough couple of weeks. I hope that these daily communications on new developments are helping you understand what's happening with our company. Here's a rundown of events from last week: we executed a commitment letter with jpmorgan and salomon smith barney that will provide us with additional secured credit lines worth $1 billion. Our northern natural gas company and transwestern pipeline company will support these assets. We now have received a total of $4 billion in credit lines, which we will use to pay off short-term commercial debt and maintain liquidity. Our board of directors elected a new member to the board - william powers, jr., the dean of the university of texas school of law in austin, texas.
polished: Tdonoho (non-privileged).pst This has been a challenging couple of weeks. I hope that these daily communications on new developments are aiding you to comprehend what's happening with our company. Here's a summary of events from last week: We executed a commitment letter with JPMorgan and Salomon Smith Barney that will provide us with additional secured credit lines worth $1 billion. Our Northern Natural Gas Company and Transwestern Pipeline Company will support these assets. We have now received a total of $4 billion in credit lines, which we will utilize to pay off short-term commercial debt and maintain liquidity. Our Board of Directors elected a new member - William Powers, Jr., the Dean of the University of Texas School of Law in Austin, Texas.

original: Skean.nsf i am attaching the ferc order and staff recommendations. The order provides for $69 million in "potential" refunds (either pay up or provide cost justification). Enron was not named as one of the 13 overcharging parties, but pge was ($3.18 million). It's not over yet, though. The order deals only with jan 01 and promises further orders regarding dec 00 and benchmark prices through april 01. The prices used to determine refunds were fairly high ($273/mwh based on gas prices, emissions costs and an assumed heat rate of over 16000). With respect to sales to california, we have concluded at least one short term sale and have talked with cal dept of water resources about longer term deals, but we were still struggling with credit issues, last i heard.
polished: I am attaching the FERC order and staff recommendations. The order suggests $69 million in "potential" refunds, meaning companies must either pay up or provide cost justification. Enron was not named among the 13 overcharging parties, but PGE was ($3.18 million). It's not over yet. The order addresses only January 2001 and hints at further orders regarding December 2000 and benchmark prices through April 2001. The prices used to determine refunds were high ($273/MWh based on gas prices, emissions costs, and an assumed heat rate of over 16000). Regarding sales to California, we have concluded at least one short-term sale and have discussed longer-term deals with the California Department of Water Resources, although credit issues remain unresolved.
