original: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, have nothing negative to say about this game as it's exceeded my expectations and will probably exeed yours too. Fluid movement, bug/crash free, lots of story/content to put you through, options for each and every day such as multiple practices, events (sponsorships) and even games. This review is purely based on playing mycareer, and so far it's 10/10. Facescan worked really well for me (used it two times, first one made me have a downsyndrome forehead though..). Keep in mind, using the mynba2k17 app will allow for you to facescan for free and allow you to earn daily vc. #sellout
polished: It puts the ball in the net or it gets the hose again. Absolutely amazing, I have nothing negative to say about this game as it has exceeded my expectations and will likely exceed yours too. Fluid movement, bug/crash free, plenty of story/content to engage you, options for each and every day including multiple practices, events (sponsorships), and even games. This review is purely based on playing mycareer, and so far it's 10/10. Facescan worked really well for me (used it two times, although the first one gave me a peculiar forehead). Keep in mind, using the mynba2k17 app lets you facescan for free and earn daily vc. #sellout

original: Magic fans beware... Wizards is afraid to make a decent digital game. At its core magic the gathering is a social game. A game to enjoy with your friends (or frenemies) laughing, talking smack, and dropping game winning bombs. Wizards of the coast seems to have forgotten this. If you choose to play with friends you cant earn gold, and gold is important. Gold is so important that they have implemented a daily cap, understandable considering gold unlocks everything in game. But get ready for a long and boring 1v1 grind against the computer or random oponents, whom you can't even speak to. If you choose to play for free, it will take you roughly 4 hours a day for upwards of a month, by yourself, to unlock the cards.
polished: Magic fans, beware... Wizards of the Coast seems hesitant to create a worthwhile digital game. Fundamentally, Magic: The Gathering is a social experience—a game to enjoy with friends (or frenemies), sharing laughs, talking smack, and executing game-winning moves. Unfortunately, Wizards of the Coast appears to have lost sight of this. When playing with friends, you can't earn gold, and gold is crucial. The importance of gold is highlighted by a daily cap, understandable given it unlocks everything in the game. Prepare for a tedious and monotonous 1v1 grind against the computer or random opponents, whom you can't communicate with. If you opt to play for free, expect to spend around 4 hours daily for almost a month by yourself to unlock the cards.

original: Being the 3rd installment in the trilogy i'll get the bad stuff out of the way first. I quite hate pre-quals as it's technically going backwards in a story and not forwards (this is an issue for every pre-qual). Granted it offers more storywise. The combat feels sloppy and doesn't feel as sharp as arkham city managed to make it. As of writing this recommendation (26/10/2013) there is a game breaking bug that stops a side mission from ever being completed (main story not effected). Some gadgets are put at a rediculous hotkey that makes your hand have to travel the whole keyboard to get to it. It might sound like nothing, but while in combat it could potentially break your combo.
polished: Being the third installment in the trilogy, I'll address the drawbacks first. I dislike prequels as they technically move backwards in a story rather than forwards (a common issue for every prequel). Granted, they offer more in terms of story. The combat feels sloppy and lacks the precision Arkham City achieved. As of writing this recommendation (26/10/2013), there is a game-breaking bug that prevents a side mission from ever being completed (main story unaffected). Some gadgets are assigned a ridiculous hotkey, requiring your hand to travel across the keyboard to use it. It might seem minor, but during combat, it could potentially disrupt your combo.

original: They basically fixed shadow warrior (2013) i.e. The bossfights are awesome, weapons feel very nice (maybe not as good as d44m's ones, but still solid), enemies aren't too spongy (if you're not too much of a retard with handling elemental and upgrade stuff). The upgrade system is really balanced and once you get around it, it's not too tedious. The elemental stuff and limited ammo softly forces you to use different weapons. Lots of cool unique (being the important word here while comparing sw2 to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ borderlands' formula of 'rng' weapons) weapons that stay viable through most of the game. The music is great, especially the main theme and of course stan bush's stuff.
polished: They significantly improved Shadow Warrior (2013). The boss fights are incredible, and the weapons feel satisfying (perhaps not quite as impressive as DOOM's, but still solid). Enemies aren't too resilient (as long as you handle elemental and upgrade features wisely). The upgrade system is well-balanced, and once you get familiar with it, it isn't cumbersome. The elemental system and limited ammo encourage diverse weapon usage. There are many cool, unique weapons that remain effective throughout most of the game. The music is fantastic, particularly the main theme and, of course, Stan Bush's contributions.

original: So many things was made wrong. I even dont know how to start this review. This all is refered to mycareer. My player is an outside scorer, pg, 1.71m, has maxed stats and got already all necessary perks. Ok, and now tell me, why the shooting skill depends to a person's hight? why a person who has 1.74m can not became so good in shooting as a person with 1.71m? i'm 1.87m in rl, made my first player with this hight and noticed then i can not reach a higher skill than 89. Why? thats a pure discrimination! and why the game does not tell me that before i create a char and not even then when i reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?!?
polished: So many things were made wrong. I don't even know how to start this review. This all refers to MyCareer. My player is an outside scorer, PG, 1.71m, with maxed stats and all necessary perks. Why does shooting skill depend on a person's height? Why can't a person who is 1.74m become as good at shooting as someone who is 1.71m? I'm 1.87m in real life, made my first player with this height and noticed I can't reach a higher skill than 89. Why? That's pure discrimination! And why doesn't the game inform me before I create a character, and not even when I reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?!

original: I think this assassin's creed nailed the mechanics down on all fronts (ship battles, sailing, hunting (fish), parkour, etc). I felt much more attached to this character as well. The story starts out extremely rough but does get much much better as you play (i think this is with every ac game personally). Edward was quite the interesting character and so was all the side characters. I felt like all the collectables actually meant something in this ac game that i never got from any of the previous ones and maybe its because i felt like they had a bigger purpose in the game. They def were not required but they were fun to get and you got rewarded in a very balanced way.
polished: I believe this Assassin's Creed installment truly mastered the mechanics across the board (ship battles, sailing, hunting, parkour, etc). I felt much more connected to this character as well. The story begins rather rough but improves significantly as you progress (I think this is true for every AC game personally). Edward was quite an intriguing character, and so were all the side characters. I felt like all the collectibles actually meant something in this AC game, which I never got from any of the previous ones. Maybe it's because they seemed to have a bigger purpose. They definitely were not required, but they were fun to collect, and you were rewarded in a very balanced way.

original: While i personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't absolutely terrible. The gunplay is alright, so long as you have the money to purchase gun parts, which would be my main complaint with this game: it's pay-to-win. If i could get past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and hrv is an excellent idea. I'd take this game over any call of duty title any day, but its pay-to-win microtransanction format is off-putting for me. If you are alright with this model, then by all means, have fun. But if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, just let this one slide; it's not our cup of tea.
polished: While I personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't entirely terrible. The gunplay is decent, provided you have the money to purchase gun parts, which is my primary complaint: it's pay-to-win. If I could get past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun and HRV is an excellent idea. I'd choose this game over any Call of Duty title, but its pay-to-win microtransaction model is off-putting for me. If you are comfortable with this model, then by all means, enjoy it. But if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, let this one slide; it's not our cup of tea.

original: While not perfect, this game has been greatly enjoyable. The save system and possibility of sudden death leads to some frustration. I'm on my first playthrough and i lost my main character around hour 10 of 20ish. Would have really liked a save to reload at that point. I've since picked up a 3rd party mod/save tool to avoid catastrophic failures. Plus the aiming reticule is on the small side and zoom is underpowered. With all that said, its been a blast. I'm not normally a zombie fan, but the combination of strategy, missions, first person shooter/beat em up is great. I've been playing it as often as i can get away... Just one more mission, just one more supply run - or i'm running away and want to get safe before shutting the game down.
polished: While not perfect, this game has been highly enjoyable. The save system and possibility of sudden death lead to some frustration. On my first playthrough, I lost my main character around hour 10 of 20ish. I would have really liked a save to reload at that point. I've since picked up a third-party mod/save tool to avoid catastrophic failures. Plus, the aiming reticule is on the small side, and zoom is underpowered. With all that said, it's been a blast. I'm not typically a zombie fan, but the combination of strategy, missions, and first-person shooter/beat-'em-up elements is great. I've been playing it as often as I can... Just one more mission, just one more supply run—or I'm running away and want to get safe before shutting down the game.

original: An absolute great stragtegy game! having played every single other wargame (european escalation, and alb), i have to say this one fits well. The number of units are great. Not sure exactly how many units there are, but there's a crap ton!!! graphics are just beautiful, sounds are great, and the gameplay overall is epic. The ingame chat box at the main menu is very entertaining as well, no i am not kidding. However, if anyone thinking this game is 'easy', or if you are new to the strategy genre, it could take you quite some time to get it nailed down. Do not get upset, you will lose a lot of units. Just make sure you plan ahead, always have anti-air, and anti-tank.
polished: An absolutely great strategy game! Having played every single other wargame (European Escalation and ALB), I must say this one fits well. The number of units is amazing. Not sure exactly how many units there are, but there are a ton! The graphics are beautiful, the sounds are great, and the gameplay overall is epic. The in-game chat box at the main menu is very entertaining as well; I'm not kidding. However, if anyone is thinking this game is 'easy,' or if you are new to the strategy genre, it might take you some time to master it. Do not get upset; you will lose units. Just plan ahead and always have anti-air and anti-tank capabilities.

original: I was negatively biased towards this game before i played it. Wasn't even sure about buying. I dunno, the whole portal gun and portals thing seemed weird to me even though i like science fiction. Boy was i wrong. The jokes and voice acting in this game is phenomenal. Just amazing. It's not cheesy (ok it's sometimes cheesy). And different story characters have all their own sense of humour. Those different characters do really have different personalities. And the level design; it's just rad. Btw i never played the first portal game. One of these days, i'm planning to if i can spare the time. I would never have played it if i hadn't played the sequel.
polished: I was negatively biased towards this game before I played it, unsure of buying it. The whole portal gun and portals concept seemed odd to me, even though I enjoy science fiction. Boy, was I wrong. The jokes and voice acting in this game are phenomenal. Just amazing. It's not cheesy (okay, it's sometimes cheesy). The different story characters each have their own sense of humor. Those unique characters truly have distinct personalities. And the level design is just rad. By the way, I never played the first Portal game. One of these days, I'm planning to if I can spare the time. I would never have played it if I hadn't played the sequel.

original: Ok lets start on the pros(+) and cons(-) then my thoughts on this game. +some of the best charecters +good story +lods of content +customisible charecter ( you can be male or female whatever you like) +you can have a relationship with most of your companions(yes fangirls you can have a love intrest) -bad graphics ( i dont think graphics really matter anyway) -weird and akward love scenes -invisible walls -theirs one mission in my opinion was boring but everyone has different tastes -+ um this isnt really bad or good but for those who care your protaginist you made cant talk okay know for my thoughts. I love this game. This game is probubly one of the best rpgs or games in general i have ever played.so if your a rpg fan you proubly already have this game.
polished:
Let's begin with the pros and cons, followed by my thoughts on this game.  

**Pros:**  
+ Some of the best characters  
+ Good story  
+ Loads of content  
+ Customizable character (you can be male or female, whatever you like)  
+ You can have a relationship with most of your companions (yes, fangirls, you can have a love interest)

**Cons:**  
- Bad graphics (I don't think graphics really matter anyway)  
- Weird and awkward love scenes  
- Invisible walls  
- There's one mission that, in my opinion, was boring, but everyone has different tastes  

**Neutral:**  
- Your protagonist can't talk, but this isn't necessarily good or bad  

Now for my thoughts. I love this game. This game is probably one of the best RPGs or games in general I have ever played. So, if you’re an RPG fan, you probably already have this game.

original: Yes, this is a nostalgia trip for thirty-somethings who remember (at least in the uk) watching the ever-irritating timmy mallet just for the five minute transformers cartoon. The voice actors for optimus, megatron, bumblebee, and many others are back, and instantly recognisable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cell-shaded presentation is perfect, and very, very generation one. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity, and woven seamlessly into combos, making it quite unlike high moon's excellent war for/fall of cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies (e.g. Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.
polished: Yes, this is a nostalgic trip for those in their thirties who remember (at least in the UK) watching the ever-irritating Timmy Mallett just for the five-minute Transformers cartoon. The voice actors for Optimus, Megatron, Bumblebee, and many others are back and instantly recognizable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cel-shaded presentation is perfect and very, very Generation One. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity and woven seamlessly into combos, making it quite unlike High Moon's excellent War for/Fall of Cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, though some enemies (e.g. Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.

original: So i downloaded the game and played it for a little while, and it was nothing special. I spent more time trying to log in though than actually playing the game. There is a bug where it says that there was an update to the terms of service or whatever and whenever you clicked 'accept' it would just pop up again. You have to restart the client for it to work. Now that isn't that bad but why do i need to link my steam and gface accounts? they say it is for dlc but why is that even necessary? it is also not reversable so now i know that a company i don't care about has access to my steam information. Now the game itself is so so. It is easily recognisable as a cod clone, except somehow they made the gunplay worse... How is that even possible?
polished: I downloaded the game and played it for a bit, and it was nothing special. I spent more time trying to log in than actually playing. There’s a bug where it says there's an update to the terms of service, and when you click 'accept,' it just pops up again. You have to restart the client for it to work. That isn’t too bad, but why do I need to link my Steam and Gface accounts? They say it’s for DLC, but why is that necessary? It’s irreversible, so now I know a company I don't care about has access to my Steam information. The game itself is mediocre. It’s easily recognizable as a COD clone, except they managed to make the gunplay worse... How is that possible?

original: 4k+ at 60fps (gtx 970), dual audio options and includes neptune gear. What's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo excellent port and a great entry point if new to the series. Just keep in mind there is lots of (skip-able) talking. As usual would suggest using a gamepad but personally i had no problems with a keymouse/mouse setup, both completely rebindable. Price is about right and wouldn't have been unhappy about a purchase. More then half the dlc is included free, which is still plenty to play with. Recommended game to all jrpg/anime/visualnovel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_
polished: 4K+ at 60fps (GTX 970), dual audio options, and includes Neptune gear. What's not to love? Excellent port and a great entry point if you're new to the series. Just keep in mind there is lots of (skippable) talking. As usual, I would suggest using a gamepad, but personally, I had no problems with a keyboard/mouse setup; both are completely rebindable. The price is reasonable, and I wouldn't have been unhappy with the purchase. More than half the DLC is included free, which is still plenty to enjoy. Recommended game for all JRPG/anime/visual novel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers.

original: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches it plays really well. Imo, this is a really great and fun game in truth, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play batman + 1 more), and the ability to use the controller for most segments of the game but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the apc commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you figure out how to use the breaks to skid around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable!)
polished: I experienced no performance issues even at release, and after all these patches, it plays exceptionally well. In my opinion, this is a truly great and fun game, although the format can be somewhat annoying, as the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies whenever you progress in the story. I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments, where you can play Batman plus one other character. The ability to use the controller for most segments of the game while switching to mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your Batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the APC commanders, becomes quite enjoyable once you master skidding around corners—and when you master that, navigating the city becomes truly enjoyable!

original: Damn fine aaa fps shooter - that's the bottom line. It's looks, sounds and plays great - great fps mechanics, nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. Not for the faint hearted though - some of those cutscenes were pretty darn cruel and vivid. But when a game overall is so great, it's easier to spot the flaws, and here they are as i saw 'em: - no sli support - wtf? i had to put the game away until i upgraded my card, as it ran too poorly on my old dual gpu gtx 590. Make sure you have a fairly decent single gpu card. - stupidly small obstacles are often unclimbable.
polished: Exceptional AAA FPS shooter—that's the bottom line. It looks, sounds, and plays wonderfully—great FPS mechanics, engaging story, intriguing characters, exceptional voice acting, and an impressive soundtrack. However, it's not for the faint-hearted—some cutscenes are quite intense. But when a game overall is this outstanding, it's easier to notice the flaws, and here they are as I observed them: - No SLI support—it's baffling. I had to shelve the game until upgrading my card because it ran poorly on my old dual GPU GTX 590. Ensure you have a decent single GPU card. - Frustratingly, small obstacles are often unclimbable.

original: English is not my native language. I am dutch. So please ignore any typing/grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review in a few categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability - graphics: the game has been set in a comic-like style. The graphics are very slick: no unnecussery details. Nice colour-scemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 pentium processor, with nvidia geforce 710m card - 8gb memory and it runs like clockwork (windows 8.1). - controls: the game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an x-box controller.
polished: English is not my native language. I am Dutch, so please overlook any typing or grammatical errors in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review into several categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability. Graphics: The game features a comic-like style, with very sleek presentation and no unnecessary details. The color schemes are well-chosen and work perfectly for this game. The graphics can be set to 'high' without overloading your system. I run this game on an i5 processor with an NVIDIA GeForce 710M card and 8GB memory, and it runs smoothly on Windows 8.1. Controls: The game can be played with a keyboard and mouse, or with an Xbox controller.

original: You can see by the hours i put into this game that i enjoy it. This is everything i wished a search game from cod would be. But dont buy this game thinking its like cod, battlefield, or any other shooter game. Its a game in its own class and should be treated as such. Cant tell you how many times i hear new players ♥♥♥♥♥ and complain about getting killed really fast. Oh god forbid you get shot in the face and ♥♥♥♥ing die. It's not like that doents happen in real life or anything. Edit:ok so ive been playing this game for awhile now. Thrown all kinds of money at it. One of the best mp games around. A good thing to play when your your not feeling cs:go.
polished: You can see from the hours I've put into this game that I enjoy it. This is everything I wished a search game from COD would be. But don't buy this game thinking it's like COD, Battlefield, or any other shooter game. It's in its own class and should be treated as such. Can't tell you how many times I hear new players complaining about getting killed quickly. Oh, forbid you get shot in the face and die. It's not like that doesn't happen in real life or anything. Edit: I've been playing this game for a while now. Thrown all kinds of money at it. One of the best multiplayer games around. A good thing to play when you're not feeling CS:GO.

original: I'm 2 hours in and am dying from this game. So funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun. But the best thing about this game beyond all that is the comedy. If you've played any rpg since the dawn of video game rpgs you will laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an rpg before then you should still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played final fantasy 7 or x you absolutely need to play this game, without giving too much away... I had to actually stop playing after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.
polished: I'm two hours in and absolutely enthralled by this game. It's hilarious. The gameplay is solid, the art design beautiful, and the music is surprisingly high-quality and fitting. I'm intrigued by the story and world, and the puzzles are enjoyable. However, the comedy is the standout feature. If you've played any RPG since the dawn of video games, you'll appreciate the jokes, parodies, and references. Even newcomers to RPGs will enjoy the humor. If you've played Final Fantasy VII or X, this game is a must-play. Without giving too much away, I had to stop after two hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.

original: I'm really sorry, i try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but i really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution has done nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but i found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress i still just simply didn't find the gameplay itself fun. It also completely lacks a pause button, or if it does have one i never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cut scene than it is game, and i end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.
polished: I'm truly sorry. I try to support free-to-play games and indie developers, but I really didn't enjoy this game. The description seemed perfect for me, but the execution fell short. I love puzzle and exploration games, yet I found this one completely unintuitive. Even after looking up how to progress, I just didn't find the gameplay fun. Additionally, it lacks a pause button—or if it does have one, I never found it. Given that many sequences are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel this game is more cut scenes than actual gameplay, leaving me drumming my fingers frequently.

original: This game.... Phew where to even start. It was absolutely beautiful, from story to graphics i was hooked. The story wasnt just some story but actually felt like i was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was telling. Gameplay was great and i learned alot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of hights which i never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but i kept through for uncle fred! if you guys made a dlc or second game, i would be the first to buy it and recomend it to everyone i know. Thanks to everyone who was involved making this, you made a absolutely beautiful game.
polished: This game... Phew, where to even start? It was absolutely beautiful; from story to graphics, I was hooked. The story wasn't just any story, but it felt like I was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the narrative my character was telling. The gameplay was fantastic, and I learned a lot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of heights, which I never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but I persevered for Uncle Fred! If you guys made a DLC or second game, I would be the first to buy it and recommend it to everyone I know. Thanks to everyone involved in making this; you crafted an absolutely beautiful game.

original: Sid meier's civilization beyond earth is a turn-based game in which you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games you were set on the earth's timeline going through periods like the stone age, medieval age, and the modern age; however, in this game you are set in the future on a mission to colonize a new planet. What i enjoy about this game is 2k took a new approach to the game and added some new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. What i didn't enjoy was that with these new mechanics the game could be overwhelming at times. What think could be improved on this game is that they could maybe incorperate some new artwork in the game such as the enviroment you experience when communicating with another leader.
polished: Sid Meier's Civilization: Beyond Earth is a turn-based game where you develop your civilization to achieve a specific goal or "victory". In previous installments, you navigated Earth's timeline, moving through eras like the Stone Age, Medieval Age, and the Modern Age. However, in this game, you're set in the future, embarking on a mission to colonize a new planet. What I enjoy about this game is that 2K adopted a fresh approach, adding innovative mechanics like the affinity system and orbital layer. One downside is these new features can be overwhelming. What I think could be improved is incorporating additional artwork to enhance the environments experienced during interactions with other leaders.

original: Great game ! tons of replayability and very fun zombie survival game ! def. In my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: after playing 60+ hours i can honestly say this is one of the better more ''realistic'' zombie games. It's very much designed like a survival horror as you must save up your ammo, heal your own wounds when you bleed out, take pills when youre infected, etc. Also, i find zombies to feel very natual to be well animated for a free to play game. P.s. : i would recomend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends/talk with the people in the chat or over voice comms.
polished: Great game! Tons of replayability and a very fun zombie survival experience! Definitely in my top 5 zombie games ever played. After playing 60+ hours, I can honestly say this is one of the better and more "realistic" zombie games. It's designed like a survival horror, requiring you to save ammo, heal wounds, and take pills when infected. Additionally, I find the zombies to be well-animated for a free-to-play game. I recommend getting one or two friends to play with, but the community is super friendly, and you can usually make friends or chat with people in the game.

original: 02/07/2014 - it's a shame i can't thoroughly recommend/enjoy this game as from the short time i've played it,i know i'd be addicted if it didn't have the following 2 game breakers. . No aussie servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage,and creates unbearable lag. Mind you,i played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering/lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Couple that with the poor ping,and it just ruins the game. . Everything artifacts like crazy - the menu's,backgrounds,training and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my oc. Set my gpu back to stock and sure enough,it didn't make a difference.
polished: 02/07/2014 - It's unfortunate I can't fully recommend or enjoy this game, as from the brief time I've played, I know I'd be hooked if it weren't for these two major issues. No Australian servers - one red bar puts you at a significant disadvantage and creates unbearable lag. Mind you, I played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering and lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Combine that with poor ping, and it just ruins the game. Everything artifacts excessively - the menus, backgrounds, training, and in-game. I've never experienced this issue before with this card and thought it might dislike my overclock. I set my GPU back to stock, and it didn't make a difference.

original: Very late last night i finished this. The story is not very deep or interesting but what makes it stand out is the story-telling. The atmosphere is filled to the brim and the many collectibles do a great job at fleshing it out. I did learn a lot about the world of batman so it was a little disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there's enough future games to rectify that. The combat is the right amount of challenge but it's more on the easy side. Leveling up batman wasn't very satisfying. It's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign which add for nice new gameplay mechanics. Getting access to previously unreachable places makes for a nice sense of progression.
polished: Late last night, I finished this. The story isn't very deep or interesting, but what makes it stand out is the storytelling. The atmosphere is immersive, and the many collectibles do a great job of fleshing it out. I learned a lot about the world of Batman, so it was disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there are enough future games to rectify that. The combat offers the right amount of challenge, but it leans more towards the easy side. Leveling up Batman wasn't satisfying; it's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign that add nice new gameplay mechanics. Accessing previously unreachable places provides a satisfying sense of progression.

original: 'to the moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think telltale's the walking dead is sad? hohoho! well, it's no match for to the moon! never before have i been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that i did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the doctor who references are endless.
polished: 'To The Moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think Telltale's 'The Walking Dead' is sad? Hohoho! Well, it's no match for 'To The Moon!' Never before have I been so deeply moved yet fulfilled by something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that I did not care at all. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the Doctor Who references are endless.

original: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, with a really great storyline. Set after some calamity happened, you start to rebuild on the bastion. There's quite a lot of choice in the game, with the choice of what to build to give you an advantage, what weapons to use and what power ups to have on those weapons as well as what drinks to use to give you a bonus effect. The art style and music in the game is fantastic, everything looks so colourful at times, who says the apocolypse has to be dull. Best of all, the game has narration based on what you, the player do. So if you end up picking up a weapon then switch it for another in the armoury, the narration would say something of you taking along the new weapon.
polished: Bastion is an exceptionally brilliant game with an engaging storyline. Set in a post-calamity world, you begin to rebuild the bastion. There's a multitude of choices in the game—determining what to construct for an advantage, selecting the weapons and power-ups, and choosing drinks for bonus effects. The art style and music are fantastic, with vibrant visuals proving the apocalypse need not be dull. Best of all, the game features dynamic narration based on your actions. For example, if you pick up a weapon and then swap it for another in the armory, the narration reflects your decision to take along the new weapon.

original: I had originally bought this game in early development, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was good. All of the guns at this point were equally overpowered, so there was no problems with imbalance; everyone could kill everyone at any time. Also, the game used to give you unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game with 'bajillions of guns', they would at least give you more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before you have to pay to get more. At one point, i had about 3 pages worth of guns, and was planning on new ideas for more, because personally, that's where i found it fun.
polished: I originally purchased this game during its early development phase when only "spacebux" was used as currency, and there was no "tech tree." This is when the game was at its best. All the guns were equally overpowered, so there were no imbalance issues; everyone could eliminate opponents at any time. Additionally, the game used to allow unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game boasting "bajillions of guns," they would at least offer more than six weapon slots and three loadouts before requiring payment for additional slots. At one point, I had around three pages of guns and was planning new ideas, because, for me, that's where the enjoyment came from.

original: This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2d platformer and an moba, and does it with style. I found myself enjoying characters that i wouldn't enjoy in other moba games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, i now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.
polished: This game was a surprising gem. Often, rave reviews about products can be misleading, but in this case, the reviews truly capture the fun of this neat little game. It's an odd mix between a classic 2D platformer and a MOBA, executed with style. I found myself enjoying characters I wouldn't typically enjoy in other MOBA games. Expecting this pattern to continue, I gave a melee tank a try anyway and was pleasantly surprised with the outcome, prompting me to experiment more as they were unlocked through playing. The art style and interface are charmingly unique. Consequently, I now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.

original: I just started playing, but i love this game. I put on my headphone and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been awhile since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are right on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubt about the navel combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! the only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming just get outta there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!
polished: I just started playing, but I love this game. I put on my headphones and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been a while since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are spot on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat encounter, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubts about the naval combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! The only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming, just get out of there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!

original: The reboot of the devil may cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for series’ protagonist, dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it’s certainly for the better; and this new game by ninja theory proves it. Dmc serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new dante, making him a compelling character to watch.image the story follows dante as he’s introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.
polished: The reboot of the Devil May Cry franchise has brought numerous changes, particularly for the series' protagonist, Dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the changes to their beloved character, it's undeniably for the better; this new game by Ninja Theory proves it. DmC serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical Dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new Dante, making him a compelling character to watch. The story follows Dante as he's introduced to the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.

original: Where do i start on this absolutely beautiful game. It's story, is absolutely charming. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments. The character design is on point, with there being various characters with various personailities and secrets to them. It sticks out from other rpg's because you don't have to kill anyone, which is an unused concept in rpg's. With lots of inspiration from earthbound, one of the best rpg's i have seen, you can tell that it is going to be good. It easily has the best soundtrack i've heard in forever.
polished: Where do I start with this absolutely beautiful game? Its story is truly charming. It is filled with detail and is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, and secrets. It is serious when necessary but doesn't shy away from funny moments. The character design is impeccable, featuring various personalities and secrets. It stands out from other RPGs because you don't have to kill anyone, a unique concept. With inspiration from EarthBound, one of the best RPGs I have seen, you can tell it will be good. It has the best soundtrack I've heard in ages.

original: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and might be a more 'enjoyable' experience for others. As for my experience, the 'game' did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Maybe i'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to warrant a reaction out of me. As for the other half of the game, it tries to paint a picture (literally) of a person in mental decline. It deals with obsession, hallucination, depression and a few other things. In theory it is a cool idea. But the 'game' took me 10 minutes to complete, and that is with reading and taking in every little bit of information i could.
polished: I am recommending this purely because it's free and might offer a more enjoyable experience for others. As for my experience, the game did not resonate with me. Half the story hinges on shock value. I was neither shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Perhaps I'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to elicit a reaction from me. Regarding the other half of the game, it attempts to illustrate (literally) a person in mental decline. It addresses obsession, hallucination, depression, and a few other themes. In theory, this is a compelling idea. However, the game took me only 10 minutes to complete, even while reading and absorbing every detail I could.

original: Do i even need to explain why portal is amazing? portal is a puzzle game, it gives you a concept then gets out. It is an amazing way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game isn't as story heavy, it did give birth to one of the most good popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when i am feeling bored and i love to come back and to see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay: portal's gameplay is quite simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to put on.
polished: Do I even need to explain why Portal is amazing? Portal is a puzzle game that introduces you to a concept and then lets you explore it. It's an incredible way to challenge your mind while still having fun. Although this game isn’t very story-heavy, it spawned one of the best popular games of 2011. I still play it and beat it when I’m bored, and I love returning to what laid the foundation for a gaming legend. Gameplay: Portal’s gameplay is simple, at least to describe. You strategically use portals, along with buttons that activate parts of the puzzle. There are two types of buttons in the game: one you press, and another that requires a cube to activate.

original: If you can overlook the bugs (which i personally only had two: one minor and the other quite annoying) edit: both bugs are resolved one fix increased my fps from 60-90 to 80-120 and are looking for a space exploration game, i can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, i'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€) radeon rx480 (~200€) z170 pro - gaming (~150€) 16gb ddr4 ram (~70€) ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range though, granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ fps on high settings vsync enabled i genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're rocking an overkill setup and get 20fps.
polished: If you can overlook the bugs (I personally encountered only two: one minor and the other quite annoying)—both of which have been resolved, and one fix even increased my FPS from 60-90 to 80-120—and are looking for a space exploration game, I can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, I'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€), Radeon RX480 (~200€), Z170 Pro-Gaming (~150€), 16GB DDR4 RAM (~70€). ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range, though granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ FPS on high settings with VSync enabled. I genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're using an overkill setup and only getting 20 FPS.

original: Remember age of mythology? yeah, it's been that long since there's been an rts game of such quality. Divinity: dragon commander reaches awfully close to these borders of my personal most favourite rts game. Combine this with a huge risk-like grand strategy mode and there, it hit the spot. I am not (read: try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to turn into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking and even commanding unit production, direction and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, i do like the complicated rts games nowadays. Think of civ v and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts and resources all into one complicated game mode.
polished: Remember Age of Mythology? It's been a long time since there's been an RTS game of such quality. Divinity: Dragon Commander comes awfully close to ranking among my personal favorite RTS games. Combine this with a compelling grand strategy mode and it hits the spot. I try not to be overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to transform into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking, and even commanding unit production, direction, and spawning simultaneously. Honestly, I do enjoy the intricate RTS games today—think of Civ V and so on. However, such games often cram complex mechanics, charts, and resources into one complicated game mode.

original: Undertale comes together to make something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title and the music is nice, but paired together they make some truly beautiful and impacting moments. The script runs the gammut from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while turning rpg tropes on their head. And all of this without touching on the world, characters, story, gameplay... I could write whole pages about it. But instead, i'll just say this: if you like rpgs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.
polished: Undertale combines its elements to create something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title, and the music is pleasant, but together they create truly beautiful and impactful moments. The script ranges from comedic to dramatic, heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes simultaneously, and subverts RPG tropes in the process. And that's without even mentioning the world, characters, story, or gameplay... I could write entire pages about it. But instead, I'll just say this: if you like RPGs, play this game. If you enjoy video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.

original: If you liked witcher 1 and 2, witcher 3 is must to get. I would give normally for this game 10/10 but unfortunatly after 1.03 this game turned into buggy ♥♥♥♥ + random crashes, so remember to save really often. When i played version 1.00 -> 1.03 my game never crashed, i didnt see any bugs. Also i have noticed that after 1.03 patch drawing distance sometimes is horrible, starting to draw objects when youre really close, sometimes even people. But if forgetting all these bugs, crashes and drawdistance 'bugs', this is really fantastic game, they made huge effort on quests, some of them really emotional and deep, lots of side quests, and the fact that your decision effects a lot in this game. I have played over 50 hours now and still going on.
polished: If you enjoyed Witcher 1 and 2, Witcher 3 is a must-have. I would ordinarily rate this game 10/10, but unfortunately, after patch 1.03, it became buggy with random crashes, so remember to save often. From version 1.00 to 1.03, my game never crashed, and I didn’t encounter any bugs. I also noticed that after the 1.03 patch, the drawing distance sometimes becomes poor, with objects appearing only when you're very close, including people. However, setting aside these issues, it's a fantastic game with huge effort put into the quests. Some are quite emotional and deep, and there are plenty of side quests. Your decisions significantly impact the game. I've played for over 50 hours now and am still captivated.

original: I have only had this game for a few months, but in just that short amount of time, two dlc's have come out, along with patches that have made an already great game into an excellent one. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics of which i am still trying to learn; however, this breadth of strategy allows you a myriad of ways to reach goals and take advantage of certain situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session i play regardless of how the play-through is going.
polished: I've only had this game for a few months, and in that short time, two DLCs have been released, along with patches that have transformed an already great game into an excellent one. The developers are very active in the community, and it shows in the various discussion forums and developer diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics, which I am still trying to master; however, this breadth of strategy offers myriad ways to reach goals and seize opportunities. The game, in my opinion, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself immersed in every session, regardless of how the playthrough is going.

original: Warframe is a fun game for the first few hours of play. After those few enjoyable hours you'll begin to see that the only thing left the game has to offer is repetition in it's combat, enemies and game play. The one major high point for the game is that the developers are working hard and do semi-frequent updates that generally include a lot of content from sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes and other tweaks/features. It's a good game to play casually. Though i doubt it will hold your attention beyond a few months unless you just really like grinding. The upside to all of this is that the game is free so i'd recommend trying it out. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.
polished: Warframe is an enjoyable game for the first few hours of play. After these enjoyable hours, you'll notice that what's left is repetition in its combat, enemies, and gameplay. A major high point is that the developers work diligently and release semi-frequent updates, often including sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes, and other tweaks/features. It's great for casual play, though it may not hold your attention beyond a few months unless you really enjoy grinding. The upside is that the game is free, so I'd recommend giving it a try. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.

original: This game is so.. Very.. Boring. I bought this game because i believed it was a pc version of 'katamari damacy', a popular and nice ps 2 game. Sadly it's far from it. In this game you go about, absorbing ever bigger things to grow bigger and absorb bigger things. But the gameplay isn't as smooth as it could be, the levels not inventive and what is in it is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show but, one that makes you rather depressed and rethink whether being alive is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game from small pets to human beings makes me wonder if the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.
polished: This game is incredibly boring. I bought it because I thought it was a PC version of 'Katamari Damacy,' a popular and delightful PS2 game. Sadly, it's far from it. In this game, you absorb progressively larger objects to grow and absorb bigger items. However, the gameplay lacks smoothness, the levels aren't inventive, and what it contains is a surreal horror show. It's not an entertaining horror show, but one that makes you feel rather depressed and question whether life is as it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game, from small pets to humans, makes me wonder if the creators had an unusual interest in taxidermy.

original: Alright. Let me explain a few things, as a person very intrested in politics, i was very interested in this game when i first heard about it. I thought, 'oh wow! a simulator of the road to becoming president! that sounds fun!' well, it really wasn't. The game starts you off and says you need to pick a side: republican or democrat, there is no independent, or third party. A little dissapointed, but still optimistic, i carried on to see what i could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is pretty fun to mess around with. It's the only time its an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.
polished: Alright, let me explain a few things. As someone deeply interested in politics, I was eager to try this game when I first heard about it. I thought, "Oh wow! A simulator about the journey to becoming president? That sounds fun!" Well, it really wasn't. The game starts by requiring you to choose a side: Republican or Democrat—no option for independents or third parties. A little disappointed but still hopeful, I continued to explore. I will give the game credit; the character customization, although limited, is quite entertaining to play with. It's the only time you can choose whether or not to wear your head during a campaign. Literally.

original: Fallout 3 story was better. Settlements get in the way of the story to the point you'll hate baby sitting them instead of playing the story. Some keys are hard coded and cannot be rebound. Bugs galore. My pipboy disappeared permanently at one point and had to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to work for power armor it's basically given to you from the beginning of the game and power cores are everywhere in trader shops. Value of power armor diminished greatly from previous fallout games. Story is medicore, everything about this game is mediocre except it doesn't crash every 10 mins like fallout 3. Very stable compared to fallout 3. Is it better than fallout 3 no. Is it better than new vegas? no. This title was so overhyped for how bad it actually is.
polished: The story in Fallout 3 was better. Settlements interfere with the narrative, making babysitting them frustrating instead of allowing you to focus on the story. Some keys are hard-coded and cannot be remapped. There are numerous bugs. My Pip-Boy disappeared permanently at one point, requiring me to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to earn power armor; it’s basically given to you from the start of the game, with power cores abundantly found in trader shops. The value of power armor is greatly reduced compared to previous Fallout games. The story is mediocre, and everything about this game is mediocre, except it doesn’t crash every 10 minutes like Fallout 3. It’s very stable compared to Fallout 3. Is it better than Fallout 3? No. Is it better than New Vegas? No. This title was extremely overhyped considering how disappointing it is.

original: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hrs to get to the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 what i liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) kind of made me not regret so much spending my time playing this game what i disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level gets much harder making it become a frustrating experience of having to do a lot of things over and over again until you get it right - achievements are too hard. There are 13 (out of 15) that only less than 2,1% of players achieved!
polished: My stats (at the time of this review): - 8.6 hrs to finish - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 What I liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not outstanding, but the ending (after the closing credits) made me not regret spending time on this game What I disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level becomes much harder, leading to a frustrating experience of repeating tasks until success - achievements are too challenging. There are 13 (out of 15) that less than 2.1% of players have achieved!

original: Pros: +graphic cons: -bugs(especially the environment, you may get stuck or your shots may hit a invisible wall despite having clear line of sight of the enemy) -game is handholding/ babysitting you -dumb ai -enemies always seem to know where you are when you are spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy which is frustrating like the first ghost warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that i couldn't care less about will not recommend it unless its 90% off even then i find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move unto the next game in my library. Considering the time i wasted on the first ghost warrior (which was equally boring and i feel liberated when i finished it), i probably won't play it until the end.
polished: Pros: +graphics Cons: -bugs (especially in the environment, you may get stuck or your shots might hit an invisible wall despite having a clear line of sight to the enemy) -game is handholding/babysitting -dumb AI -enemies always seem to know where you are once spotted -enemy accuracy is frustrating, like the first Ghost Warrior -terrible checkpoints and saves -boring story that I couldn't care less about. I will not recommend it unless it's 90% off; even then, I find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move on to the next game in my library. Considering the time I wasted on the first Ghost Warrior (which was equally boring and I felt liberated upon finishing), I probably won't play until the end.

original: Review for 29/11/2015 do not buy this game, servers offline. You can't play. No compres este juego, servidores offline. No puedes jugar. While i could play it, i enjoyed it. original: Who wouldn't want to wear a fez? :d this puzzle platforming game stars a little guy with a fez who goes around collecting little bits to form a cube and navigating through a fairly large branching map. This game is quite amusing and running through it to complete the game was quite a bit of fun. ^_^ it can become semi-frustrating if you want to get all the cubes and achievements though. polished: Who wouldn't want to wear a fez? This puzzle platforming game features a little character with a fez who travels around collecting bits to form a cube while navigating a large branching map. This game is quite entertaining, and completing it is very enjoyable. However, attempting to collect all the cubes and achieve all the accomplishments can be somewhat challenging. To obtain every cube, you'll need to crack codes that must be deciphered—sometimes taking mere seconds or driving you to consult a guide. (*raises hand* I gave up.) The guide, "A Complete Guide to Fez," can be quite helpful!

original: It's not hard for me to see why other people like this game, but it wasn't for me. For one thing i have a vive and i'm much more interested in playing room sized games with the controllers. Beyond that, the game is initially awe inspiring in the scale of its universe, but i also felt that same scale was a hinderence to my enjoyment. The learning curve and the amount of time to do anything interesting at the beginning were both too large for me. Perhaps if i were more patient and had more time for gaming this would be compelling to me. But i don't have either and there are plenty more vr games i'd rather spend my time on.
polished: I can understand why others are drawn to this game, but it wasn't for me. I own a Vive and prefer room-sized games with the controllers. While the game’s universe initially amazed me with its scale, I found that same vastness impeded my enjoyment. The learning curve and the time required to engage in interesting activities at the start were too steep for my liking. Perhaps if I were more patient and had more gaming time, it might be appealing. However, I lack both and there are many other VR games I'd rather dedicate my time to.

original: Hands down my favorite first person shooter of all time. Run and gun rambos need not apply. Recoil and ballistics are realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle caliber weapons almost always result in death unless it just grazes you. Rounds drop over distance and short, controlled bursts are required if you wish to remain on target. There is no magical ammunition pool. If you reload half-way through your magazine all the time then you will have a pouch full of half full mags. You can't run forever. If you sprint for a while your aim will suffer as you gasp heavily until you have caught your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing.
polished: Hands down my favorite first-person shooter of all time. Run-and-gun rambos need not apply. Recoil and ballistics are realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle-caliber weapons almost always result in death unless it just grazes you. Rounds drop over distance, and short, controlled bursts are required to remain on target. There is no magical ammunition pool. If you reload halfway through your magazine all the time, you'll have a pouch full of partially full mags. You can't run forever; if you sprint for a while, your aim will suffer as you gasp heavily until you catch your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing.

original: Let me start off by saying i did not purchase eu when it first came out and that i got it on sale which included ew so i never experienced the issues that some people claim to have had with that game. I loved that game however, it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when you did things right. As for xcom2 i love it, the game plays pretty well for me on medium and i am running a gtx560 with 2gb of vram. At first the game set it to high and it was running a bit sluggishly but not to the point of being unplayable but when i dropped it down to medium it smoothed on out. Not sure if i am just lucky when it comes to having issues with games or what but it seems that most of the negative reviews sound like they are coming from some really entitled people.
polished: Let me start by saying I did not purchase EU when it first came out; I got it on sale including EW, so I never experienced the issues some claim with that game. I loved that game, though it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when things went right. As for XCOM 2, I love it; the game performs well on medium settings, and I am running a GTX560 with 2GB of VRAM. Initially, the game set the graphics to high, causing some sluggishness, but not to the point of being unplayable. When I lowered the settings to medium, it smoothed out. I'm not sure if I'm merely lucky with game issues, but it seems that most negative reviews sound like they come from some really entitled people.

original: World leaders gather to face uncertainty more than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe are arriving in the swiss mountain resort davos for the annual world economic forum (wef). For five days, they will discuss issues ranging from china's economic power to iraq's future after this sunday's elections. Uk prime minister tony blair and south african president thabo mbeki are among the more than 20 government leaders and heads of state leaders attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the wef are expected to be muted. Anti-globalisation campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The brazilian city of porto alegre will host the rival world social forum, timed to run in parallel with the wef's ritzier event in davos.
polished: World leaders gather to face uncertainty as more than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe arrive in the Swiss mountain resort of Davos for the annual World Economic Forum (WEF). Over five days, they will discuss issues ranging from China's economic power to Iraq's future following this Sunday's elections. UK Prime Minister Tony Blair and South African President Thabo Mbeki are among over 20 government leaders and heads of state attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the WEF are expected to be muted. Anti-globalization campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The Brazilian city of Porto Alegre will host the rival World Social Forum, timed to coincide with the WEF's event in Davos.

original: Deadline nears for fiat-gm deal fiat and general motors (gm) have until midnight on 1 february to settle a disagreement over a potential takeover. The deadline marks the point at which fiat will gain the right to sell its car division to gm, part of an alliance agreed in 2000. Gm, whose own european operations are losing money, no longer wants to own the unprofitable fiat unit. Reports of deadlocked talks sent fiat shares down 1.2% on tuesday, after monday's 4% gain on hopes of a payoff. The us firm is thought to be offering about $2bn (£1.06bn) to extricate itself from the arrangement. It has argued the deal was voided by fiat's decision to sell off fiat's finance arm and halve gm's stake via a capital-raising effort. The 2000 deal resulted from a race between gm and daimlerchrysler to ally with fiat.
polished: As the deadline nears for the Fiat-GM deal, Fiat and General Motors (GM) have until midnight on February 1 to resolve a disagreement over a potential takeover. This deadline marks when Fiat gains the right to sell its car division to GM, part of an alliance agreed upon in 2000. GM, whose own European operations are losing money, no longer wishes to own the unprofitable Fiat unit. Reports of stalled negotiations caused Fiat shares to drop 1.2% on Tuesday, following Monday's 4% gain on takeover hopes. The US firm is believed to be offering about $2 billion (£1.06 billion) to extricate itself from the arrangement. GM has argued that the deal was voided by Fiat's decision to sell off its finance arm and halve GM's stake via a capital-raising effort. The 2000 alliance resulted from a competitive race between GM and DaimlerChrysler to partner with Fiat.

original: Cardinal criticises iraq war cost billions of pounds spent on conflict in iraq and in the middle east should have been used to reduce poverty, cardinal cormac murphy-o'connor has said. The head of the catholic church in england and wales made the comments on bbc radio 4 and will re-iterate his stance in his christmas midnight mass. The cardinal used a christmas message to denounce the war in iraq as a "terrible" waste of money. He and the archbishop of canterbury have both spoken out about the war. Speaking on bbc radio 4's thought for the day slot, he criticised the fact that "billions" have been spent on war, instead of being used to bring people "out of dire poverty and malnourishment and disease". The cardinal said 2005 should be the year for campaigning to "make history poverty".

Speaking on BBC Radio 4's Thought for the Day slot, he criticized the fact that "billions" have been spent on war, instead of being used to bring people "out of dire poverty and malnourishment and disease." The cardinal said 2005 should be the year for campaigning to "make poverty history.

original: British stars denied major oscars british hopes of winning major oscars were dashed as uk stars failed to win acting and directing prizes. Despite three nominations, mike leigh's vera drake failed to take the director or screenplay awards and there was no prize for star imelda staunton. Kate winslet also lost to best actress hilary swank, while clive owen and sophie okonedo failed to win best supporting actor awards. The uk's andrea arnold won the short film award for her gritty drama wasp. Arnold, who presented children's television shows number 73 and motormouth in the 1980s, said it was "totally overwhelming" to win. Wasp tells the story of a single mother living on the breadline, beating films by fellow uk nominees gary mckendry and ashvin kumar.
polished: British stars were denied major Oscars, as UK talents didn't secure acting or directing prizes. Despite three nominations, Mike Leigh's "Vera Drake" didn't win the director or screenplay awards, and Imelda Staunton did not receive a prize. Kate Winslet lost the Best Actress award to Hilary Swank, while Clive Owen and Sophie Okonedo did not win Best Supporting Actor awards. However, the UK's Andrea Arnold won the Short Film Award for her gritty drama "Wasp." Arnold, who presented children's television shows "Number 73" and "Motormouth" in the 1980s, expressed feeling "totally overwhelming" upon winning. "Wasp" tells the story of a single mother living on the breadline, beating films by fellow UK nominees Gary McKendry and Ashvin Kumar.

original: Halloween writer debra hill dies screenwriter and producer debra hill, best known for her work on the 70s horror classic halloween, has died in los angeles aged 54. Hill, who had been suffering from cancer, co-wrote the 1978 film, which starred jamie lee curtis as a babysitter terrorised by a psychopath. Directed by john carpenter, it made over $60m (£31.3m) worldwide - a record for independent film at that time. Hill also worked with carpenter on escape from new york and the fog. Born in new jersey, hill began her career as a production assistant and worked her way through the ranks, becoming an assistant director and second-unit director before she began collaborating with carpenter. She was regarded by many as a pioneering woman in film, taking on jobs in the 70s that were more commonly taken by men.
polished: Debra Hill, a renowned screenwriter and producer, best known for her work on the 70s horror classic "Halloween," has died in Los Angeles at the age of 54. Hill, who had been suffering from cancer, co-wrote the 1978 film, starring Jamie Lee Curtis as a babysitter terrorized by a psychopath. Directed by John Carpenter, it earned over $60m (£31.3m) worldwide—a record for independent film at that time. Hill also collaborated with Carpenter on "Escape from New York" and "The Fog." Born in New Jersey, Hill began her career as a production assistant and advanced through the ranks, becoming an assistant director and second-unit director before she started working with Carpenter. She was regarded by many as a pioneering woman in film, taking on roles in the 70s that were more commonly held by men.

original: Broadband fuels online expression fast web access is encouraging more people to express themselves online, research suggests. A quarter of broadband users in britain regularly upload content and have personal sites, according to a report by uk think-tank demos. It said that having an always-on, fast connection is changing the way people use the internet. More than five million households in the uk have broadband and that number is growing fast. The demos report looked at the impact of broadband on people's net habits. It found that more than half of those with broadband logged on to the web before breakfast. One in five even admitted to getting up in the middle of the night to browse the web. More significantly, argues the report, broadband is encouraging people to take a more active role online.
polished: Broadband fuels online expression as fast web access encourages more people to express themselves online, research suggests. It states that having an always-on, fast connection is changing the way people use the internet. More than five million households in the UK have broadband, and that number is growing rapidly. The Demos report examined the impact of broadband on people's internet habits. It revealed that more than half of those with broadband logged on to the web before breakfast. One in five even confessed to getting up in the middle of the night to browse the web. More significantly, the report argues, broadband encourages people to take a more active role online.

original: Yukos heading back to us courts russian oil and gas company yukos is due in a us court on thursday as it continues to fight for its survival. The firm is in the process of being broken up by russian authorities in order to pay a $27bn (£14bn) tax bill. Yukos filed for bankruptcy in the us, hoping to use international business law to halt the forced sale of its key oil production unit, yuganskneftegas. The unit was however sold for $9.4bn to state oil firm rosneft but only after the state auction had been disrupted. Yukos lawyers now say the auction violated us bankruptcy law. The company and its main shareholders have vowed to go after any company that buys its assets, using all and every legal means.
polished: Yukos is heading back to U.S. courts. The Russian oil and gas company is due in court on Thursday, continuing its battle for survival. The firm is being dismantled by Russian authorities to settle a $27 billion (£14 billion) tax bill. Yukos filed for bankruptcy in the U.S., aiming to leverage international business law to stop the forced sale of its key oil production unit, Yuganskneftegas. However, the unit was sold for $9.4 billion to state oil firm Rosneft, but this occurred only after the state auction faced disruptions. Yukos's lawyers argue that the auction violated U.S. bankruptcy law. The company and its main shareholders are determined to pursue legal action against any entity that acquires its assets.

original: Voters flock to blog awards site voting is under way for the annual bloggies which recognise the best web blogs - online spaces where people publish their thoughts - of the year. Nominations were announced on sunday, but traffic to the official site was so heavy that the website was temporarily closed because of too many visitors. Weblogs have been nominated in 30 categories, from the top regional blog, to the best-kept-secret blog. Blogs had a huge year, with a top us dictionary naming "blog" word of 2004. Technorati, a blog search engine, tracks about six million blogs and says that more than 12,000 are added daily. A blog is created every 5.8 seconds, according to us research think-tank pew internet and american life, but less than 40% of the total are updated at least once every two months.
